title: Remove SMS features from the app
body:
Starting July 2019, apps will not be allowed to use the READ_SMS permission unless they are the default SMS app.

See https://play.google.com/about/privacy-security-deception/permissions/ for details.

There is a list of exceptions on https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/9047303 but KISS doesn't seem to qualify for any.

This means that KISS will have to be updated in the coming months to remove the feature that adds incoming messages senders to history.

title: Clone
body:
(please read this text, then remove it to write your issue)

Thanks for taking the time to help us improve KISS!

## Submitting a bug?
Make sure you include the following:

* app version
* android version
* device used
* custom settings that might have an impact
* one or more screenshot

## Submitting a feature request?
Make sure the issue title is descriptive enough :)
Then explain what you're looking for, what problem it will solve and feel free to include a mockup (even a Paint drawing is fine) to ensure we're all on the same page

title: Number Keyboard when entering phone numbers
body:
Hey, I often pass on my phone to others so that they type in their phone number. They easily get confused because of course the numbers only appear in the topmost row of the text keyboard, when I switch to symbols and numbers.

Could you implement a switch that allows to turn the search bar into a number input? [Here ](https://stackoverflow.com/a/1121336/9778755)is SO documentation on that.

![kiss-mockup-number-keyboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8948865/47489214-5d559400-d846-11e8-89e5-9ca238d0ad9e.png)

PS.: I imagine that - in order to avoid more buttons in the search bar - the switch could be an entry in the three-dot-menu or the keyboard could change when you long-press the three-dot menu.

title: [Feature Request] Add option to lock favourites (disable drag and drop)
body:
An older person I know keeps deleting her favourites because she presses and holds the favourite icons for too long. She just wants to launch the apps, but the result is often that drag and drop gets triggered and the icon is eventually moved outside of the bar and deleted.

For youngsters this may seem like a user issue, but such difficulties with clicking, tapping, and controlling of an input device (such as finger or mouse) are actually very common with older people. If possible, please add an option to lock the favourites which would disallow any user interaction with them other than launching the apps.

Hi,

I would like to use my icon pack in KISS, which I have made by the app "Icon Pack Studio" (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=ginlemon.iconpackstudio), but sadly, it does not work. When I choose the icon pack, the icons just do not change. Please add support for it.

title: hide app launcher, not exclude it
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Some apps have two (or more) launch icons and sometime it is useful to just exclude/hide one of them. But currently when you exclude an app (an app launcher) everything that comes with that app (the other launch icons) will be hidden too. And that's not really what one would expect.

For example, the [xkcd browser](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.floern.xkcd) app has two launchers: one for xkcd comic and the other for What If. I don't use the What If launcher very often, as it does not update so frequently and because I like to get rid of unnecessary things and keep only the minimum (so that's why I use KISS) so I try to hide/exclude What If launcher. But that results in hiding the other launcher too, which is not what I wanted to do.

So if we have a feature to hide specific icons instead of excluding everything that comes with an app (are the widgets included?) would be much appreciated. Thanks.

title: [Feature request] Option to hide the app launcher ring
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I use this launcher mainly as a distraction free, no nonsense tool in my life. In particular, I stay away from drawer based launchers since people (including me) have the habit of opening them to choose some app to procrastinate on. I would like to hide the app launcher ring on KISS, so that I only have access to the search box -- I open an app when I need it, so much so that I search for it to open it.

This functionality is similar to that in Evie launcher, for instance.

Can an option be added in KISS settings to toggle visibility of the launcher ring? (Btw I am completely new to Android dev, so if someone can guide me with some details, maybe I could submit a pull request.)

title: Search should be urlencoded (right now +& breaks search)
body:
* Version 3.5.2
* Android 7.0
* Moto G5 Plus

When I search for `a+b` (via Google), the query is interpreted as `a b`. When I search for `a&b=c`, the query is interpreted as `search?q=a&b=c` (everything after the first ampersand is truncated).

You need to urlencode user input when sending to search.

Many browsers, when sending HTML forms (like the Google web search form), use + instead of %20 for spaces. There's some details at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Query_string#URL_encoding .

title: Update search providers to use %s instead of {q}
body:
The previous implementation required search providers to use `{q}`.
Although it did work, it went against the documentation from most search engines, that specified a URL with the more standard `%s` used by browsers.

This PR migrates {q} to %s, while still ensuring that old search engines defined in the past still work.
Going forward, adding a new provider will require to use %s.

Documentation was updated too.

title: Exclude favorites from history properly
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
It seems that favorites are being excluded from the history list at the wrong moment.

For example, suppose I have app Foo, bar and baz in my favorites.

Suppose I most recently used apps Foo, bar, baz, A, B, C, D. (First app most recent)

My max. items in history and search results setting is 4.

I select 'exclude favorites from history'.

Then only app A shows in my history list, but it should show A, B, C, D (imho).

title: Add other messaging icons to contact quick menu
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I've set an alternative messaging app (signal) to replace my default texting app, so this works nicely for contacts who use signal. However, I communicate with the majority of my contacts through WhatsApp, and cannot open this from the contact preview in KISS; only once I open the contact the little icon for it shows up. Right now it is therefore quicker to open the app itself.

It would be great if we could set apps to show in the contract previews resulting from a search.

Thanks for the amazing launcher!

PS: even further integration that would show WhatsApp groups in search results would be even more amazing, but I can see how that may not be on the roadmap.

title: Feature Request: sort contacts according to the frequncy they are contacted
body:
The stock android apps, like `com.android.messaging` for example, can know what contacts you are most frequently contacting and it (at least on Lineage OS) displays them at the top when searching.
I'm no android developer but I was wondering if it would be possible to implement it in KISS as well.

I know very little about android development but I assume the implementation of this frequently accessed contacts is based [here in the `com.android.messaging` source tree](https://github.com/LineageOS/android_packages_apps_Messaging/blob/16eb6f8cb544f7ce6bcad8e0463d4301fb557053/src/com/android/messaging/datamodel/FrequentContactsCursorBuilder.java).

Thanks for a wonderful launcher BTW!

title: Allow live wallpapers to use touch features
body:
When using a live wallpaper such as those created using KLWP, there is a 5 second delay after using a "touch feature", for example, trying to open an app using the live wallpaper. More information can be found here on how to implement this feature:
https://help.kustom.rocks/i194-launchers-touch-features-support-aka-remove-5-secs-delay

title: Gray out or hide work profile icons when work profile is turned off
body:
Love the launcher, it's been at the center of my phone for over a year now.

When work profile is turned off (through the top pull-down menu thing), clicking on icons produces an error, asking you if you want to turn on a work profile (as it should).

Having a visual indicator of work profile being turned off in KISS by graying out the icons would be very useful (default Pixel Launcher does that, so it's likely there's a built-in way to do this).

An alternative would be to hide the work profile icons when work profile is turned off.

title: App list moves to bottom when Fennec F-Droid is reached whilst scrolling
body:
* app version - 3.5.2
* android version - 7.0
* device used - SM-J330FN
* custom settings that might have an impact - N/A
* one or more screenshot - N/A

The problem occurs when scrolling from below Fennec F-Droid slowly. When scrolling quickly, I guess it skips displaying Fennec F-Droid so the problem doesn't occur. It also doesn't occur when scrolling from above Fennec F-Droid. When it is excluded from KISS, the problem also doesn't occur. Fennec F-Droid is version 61.0 and was obtained from F-Droid.

title: Individually change app icons
body: A lot of the time when trying to apply an icon pack, it will not automatically change every icon. Many other launchers include the option to manually change each icon via a menu option to solve this. I realize that you're trying to keep the launcher as minimal as possible but I feel that this is a necessary feature since we already have the ability to use custom icon packs.

title: WebApps shortcuts not displaying
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
* KISS v3.5.1
* LineageOS 15.1-20180628_231653 Android 8.1.0
* Sony Xperia XA2 H3123 (pioneer)

When using WebApps (com.tobykurien.webapps v2.17 on F-Droid), the "create shortcut" feature does not create one. It works for the defauld Trebuchet launcher so I assume this is a KISS issue.
I have never used shortcuts before so I don't know how they normally work in KISS or in general, but now that my new phone can run Google Docs in a browser without running out of memory, I prefer to do that over using microG.

![screenshot_trebuchet_20180718-191605](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16788697/42914389-b4c6d1a6-8abf-11e8-9db0-ac50edc92c17.png)
Spot the fakes! (Docs and Webmail)

In this case some apps could be square and others with a circle, but it would still look nicer than with a white circle.

body:

Android 6.0
Lenovo K10a40

First of all: 

Thank you for this wonderful peace of software, I like KISS very much!!!
It's simply a pleasure to use a smartphone with this launcher, GREAT WORK!!!

One small bug, no big issue:

After adding any of the available widgets to KISS, when screen orientation is set to automatic and device is turned from vertical to horizontal screen orientation, widget at once disappears, reproducible. Forever, does not return when orientation is switched back to vertical.

Add widget again in vertical orientation. Easy job, settings for widget I use are kept.

title: LG G6 H873 Crashing Continually
body:
Greetings,

Firstly, love love love the launcher very much. Told many about it - but there is an issue that I'm sure you are already probably aware of but I felt the need to squawk and pretend I'm involved 

I have a stock, non-rooted and untouched internally LG G6 H-873 that is running Android Oreo (8.0) and upon fresh install and no other apps I always install KISS Launcher for some needed classing up and speed increase. Everything seems to be fine right up to the point where I tap the little green logo icon on the lowest left of my screen - crash. Restart app and try again and - crash. 

I am not able to grab a screenshot because it's crashed. I was considering a different phone, that's how much I love your launcher, but the store refused refund so now I wait with stock slow and boring till I have kids back.

I hope you can fix it quick because stock vanilla boring is starting to hurt my eyes?

Cheers,

Cameron

title: [Feature Request] Instant Answers, for example with DuckDuckGo
body:
Good morning and thanks for creating an awesome launcher. I like the new 'basic math' feature. DuckDuckGo has many more features like that one ('instant answers'). There is an  [API](https://duckduckgo.com/api) for fetching them. It's quite simple. It would be nice if DuckDuckGo instant anwers could be included directly in KISS, possibly as an optional feature that can be enabled in the settings.
Thanks again!

title: [Crash] math that crashes + fr
body:
2*.2 crashes on dot.
FR: plz improve math for 3+ argument operations: 2+2+2 . Don't forget about op priority: 2-2/2 == 1

title: Add ability to do basic math (fix #481)
body:
Adds the ability to run basic math (`+ - * /`) from KISS.

![2018-06-16 21 48 28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/41502413-855d8e90-71b1-11e8-975e-06e50004b8f3.png)
![2018-06-16 21 48 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/41502414-85780202-71b1-11e8-98c3-dc9db8ceb147.png)

Nice Unicode forms of "*" and "/" are also supported, as they are present in some keyboards by default and people might want to use them:
![2018-06-16 21 48 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/41502415-85911ddc-71b1-11e8-8c11-d67e5d29a54c.png)

Keep in mind however that this uses floating point arithmetic behind the scene, which can lead to some unexpected results!
![2018-06-16 21 48 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/41502416-85ab14a8-71b1-11e8-85ff-8e66ad7f829e.png)

As mentioned in #481, advanced uses are not supported either -- no parenthesis, modulo, or trigonometric functions.

Clicking on the result has no effect.

I've also used the opportunity to slightly refactor the `PhoneProvider`, making it more memory efficient (it's not an Android service anymore, as it doesn't have to store any state)

title: WiFi toggle switch disappeared after update
body:
Hi,

I have noticed that WiFi toggle switch disappeared after some update. I don't know exact version because I haven't updated KISS for a while. 

I don't see any option to restore it. Was it intended?

Thank you

title: Buying the devs a coffee
body: Is there a way to make a small donation to the devs? :)

title: Disabling dragging while dragging
body: Fixes #1006

title: Are KISS settings retained beetwen downgrades?
body: I would like to downgrade to v3.0.13. Will my settings be retained?

title: Feature request: Scrollable favorites bar
body: Can you make the favorites bar scrollable ? That way I can add a dozen favorites... Right now, the limit is 5 and it isn't enough

title: Productivity enhancement - use home screen as links/ shortcuts page
body:
I have been using KISS for a few years now and hugely appreciate how it allows me to concentrate on what I need to do without any visual distractions, the streamline d approach to find the apps or info I need is  i believe perfect. 
My observation and feature request is... could the clutterfree screen be used as a paste board for links to files, shortcuts for items of interest?? the widgets (beta) seemed a step in this direction but personally the search bar covers this requirement from my point of view. A pasteboard for stuff  I can't find through the search bar is what I would really find useful.

I am no coder but i recognise the true benefits KISS offers, but believe this could enhance the productivity further by using the screen to store and access info the search bar can't find ... I'm thinking like an old pc desktop screen...an untidy but visual snap shot of what's to do next... clear the desk when new stuff comes in. Old skool - but if made simple to use with a share command; very useful... KISS for me as always been about no distractions and getting the job done. This  enhancement embraces that ethos -  search bar for the tools , screen for the materials... for  want of a better metaphor. 

But overall superb app!!

title: Message error when pressing contact
body:
App version: 3.4.0
Android version: 7.1.1
Device used: BlackBerry KeyOne (BBB100-1)

When pressing a contact row it displays a toast saying something like "something wrong happened, try again later". If I click the direct call icon in the contact row it works fine.

It seems the app is unable to start some intent to view contact information.

title: How to add startpage search provider?
body:
Startpage is a brilliant privacy focused search provider that uses Google results without telling. One of the implications of it's privacy design is that the URL does not contain the search details (see sample URL below). KISS currently requires the {q} placeholder where the search text would otherwise go. Does anyone know a work around for this?

https://www.startpage.com/do/search
Thanks for taking the time to help us improve KISS!

title: Setting to sort App list was removed
body:
Starting with version 3.3.0, there is no more possibilty to sort the app list. The config option that was still available in 3.2.0, was removed.

Please include this config option again.

title: [Feature request] Add "force stop" to long press contextual menu
body: The contextual menu has a "uninstall" entry, which is very nice. It would be cool to also have a "force stop" entry so apps can be stopped without going to the app info page.

title: Swipe typing doesn't work in search bar
body:
Neither Googles Gboard keyboard nor SwiftKeys keyboard allow swipe typing. 

* app version
3.4.0
* android version
8.0.0
* device used
Motorola Z2

title: Some telephone numbers on the phone are not detected by KISS search bar
body:
Hello,
I use KISS (version 3.3.0) on a Nexus 5 with Cyanogenmod 15.1 (latest build).

Some of the telephone numbers saved in my contacts app are not recognized if I want to search the number in the search bar of KISS. These are normal numbers saved in the +49 xxxxx xxxxx format, like any other numbers which are recognized by KISS.
This happens on just 4 of my 200+ contacts, but unfortunately these are part of my most important numbers - one contact for example is the contact of my wife. KISS detects her mobile phone number but not the number of our telephone at home. Both numbers are saved in the same contact on the phone. Deleting the number and adding that new does not help. Deleting the whole contact and adding a new one does not help either.

I cannot see any regularity in this, so I don't have any clue...

This also happens on my company phone (Samsung A5-2017 with stock Android 7), also with the same contacts.

title: Disabling tags doesn't work
body:

body:
Hi guys. Was going through the play store comments, and I absolutely second Benedict Lee's feature request. Would be great if we could totally hide the "O" and the "three dots" in the search bar... especially for ones like me who use semi-transparent keyboards and leave it on all the time. title: Fix issue with dragging with only 1 favorite
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Fixes #998 

Basically when there is only 1 favorite, there are no other drop listeners.
This way we just stop you from dragging when there is only 1 favorite, as it doesn't do anything for you by dragging anyway.

title: Favourite Bar Small Icons [Add option for icon size]
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
KISS launcher displays icons in the Favourite's bar at a reduced size when compared to other launchers. This affects system icons and custom icon packs. Some packs are purposely made to be large (these look normal in KISS), whereas standard icon packs appear small. I have submitted 2 screenshots, one running KISS, the other running the same icon pack on Lawnchair Launcher with icon scale set at 100%.



- KISS v3.1.0
- Android 7.0
- Huawei P9 Mini Lite (SLA-L02)
- EMUI 5.1




![screenshot_20180520-192733](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38180101/40281615-7b35fdc4-5c64-11e8-8667-95b90c9c38d3.png)
![screenshot_20180520-192720](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38180101/40281622-8ed6b9d6-5c64-11e8-8ad7-4ebdaa351b9b.png)

A simple fix (increasing default size) would be sufficient, a more comprehensive solution (adding icon size options) is not **really** necessary, although I think a lot of people would appreciate it.

title: Faster loading time at startup
label: [Label(name="performance")]
body:
In current master, providers are loaded serially, with a simple call to `.execute()`.

Most device nowadays have more than one core, so in 81569faeaad4ba6cb9a54b7872c47f783531e329 I've experimented with a thread pool:

https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/81569faeaad4ba6cb9a54b7872c47f783531e329/app/src/main/java/fr/neamar/kiss/dataprovider/Provider.java#L60

This is currently only on the "tracking" branch, to measure results.

On my device, it's relatively faster (see commit details), but it will be interesting to see how the 90th or 99th percentile perform, as we wouldn't want to make them slower.

I do think that the UX should be consistent for all touchable icons.

It might be that the change in visual feedback was introduced in #970.

title: [DNM] Reporting of settings in use for KISS beta
body:
**tl;dr**: the beta version of KISS will monitor a couple of metrics over the coming weeks, to provide opportunities to remove unused features, improve the onboarding experience by settings sensible defaults, and allow the developers to focus on the features most in-use.

## I'm not in the beta / I use f-droid, what is changing for me?
Nothing. KISS will not have access to the internet. Your data will stay on your device forever :heart: 

## I'm in the beta, can you start with why?!
Everyone hates tracking, and that includes me and the other KISS developers. 
Our [privacy policy is super clear](https://kisslauncher.com/privacy): the default version of KISS does not have access to the Internet, and your data is your data. Period.

However, with time, we've noticed that we had no visibility over which features were used, and which weren't. This led to slow development ([just look at everything that has to be tested for a release!](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/master/qa-suite.md)) and user frustration when we were unable to assess the real impact of a missing feature or bug.

To solve that, I'm starting an audit of the settings currently being used by the beta users on the Play Store ([want to join the beta?](https://play.google.com/apps/testing/fr.neamar.kiss)).

For the next couple of weeks, the beta version will report the settings currently enabled and a couple of metrics described below.

**If you do not want to be tracked, that's obviously perfectly fine and understandable! Just [opt-out of the beta](https://play.google.com/apps/testing/fr.neamar.kiss) to get the standard, internet-less KISS.**

## What is tracked?
If you want to get a complete list, you should check the changes [here](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/979/files), but here is the high-level recap of the events:

* Time to load KISS (includes the *number* of apps and contacts, to normalize the data; of course, no actual apps or contacts are sent)
* Time to load search results (include the *length* of the query, of course, no text query is sent)
* Click on a result (includes the type of result being clicked [app? contact? shortcut?], and the relevance of the result [score]. Of course the name of the result is never sent)
* Click on a favorite (includes the type of the favorite [app? contact?] and the favorite position (from 1 to 6)
* All apps button clicked

In addition to those events, the following properties are aggregated with a random user-id:

* device model
* Android version
* app version
* approximate geolocation (country)
* Locale being used (to improve translation effort)
* value for each boolean settings (e.g. "rounded bar enabled")
* value for each setting not containing user information (for instance, your search providers settings are not sent) (e.g. "theme being used")

## Who will have access to the data?
For now, that's only me.
The data will likely be shared with long-term developers on a need-to-know basis; this will probably include @sandoche @saveman71 @psykzz @TBog @licaon-kter.
Data will never be shared outside of those individuals, or sold, or anything. It will only be used to inform future developments.
Data is stored in Amplitude's server, more info about their privacy and security [here](https://amplitude.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/206533238-Data-Security-Privacy).

Keep in mind that we all care about KISS. I've worked on this project for nearly 10 years, and I'm just trying to make it better. I have a job outside and don't need any money or rubbish "you're not the customer you're the product" mentality. I do *care* about this and will fight to the end to make sure this data is used (and discarded after use) correctly.

## I have more questions!
I understand this is a tricky topic, if you have any additional question or concern please send an email to contact@kisslauncher.com or even better, comment on this PR.

## Uh, I'm a dev and this is a very unusual PR!
Yup, I've hijacked the description field to add more info about this.
Feel free to review the PR, but *do not merge* it!

title: Enable fast scroll on app list
body:
Fix #926 by enabling fast-scroll (alphabet scrolling) on the app list.

It should work equally well with non-ascii character, as I'm using the normalized result name.

![2018-05-07 11 06 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/39697006-6337b8a2-51e7-11e8-8f13-8ec537e2e8bf.png)

This also removes the option to sort apps from Z to A, as the implementation got quite messy for not real value. See comment in 00f5f5f.

Documentation on fast scroll: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/SectionIndexer

body:
If you start typing a phone number (`+1...`), the keyboard switches to "phone input", which moves all the keys around.

This is super confusing, as you're typing and you don't expect the keys to shift.

This commit disables this behavior.

title: new gestures support breaks swipe left to access history
body:
Prior to gestures support, with a widget on the home screen, I was able to swipe left to access the History.

Now, with gestures support, this no longer works.  Swipe left is interpreted as swipe down and pulls down Notifications.

(I don't really care for that level of access to Notifications; reaching to the top to swipe down is just fine.)

Using 
- KISS v3.1 *with widget* from F-Droid on (1) Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 with Android v7.0 and (2) Google Pixel with Android v8.1.0.
- Minimalistic UI `enabled`, with *Show history on touch* `enabled`.

title: Create FAQ update
body: I have added ^ more important questions and their answers to help users more. thank you for the opportunity of being part of the project.

title: Changes to history (tap zone and settings)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**With "Show history on touch" turned on:**

1) When tapping the screen to show history, the only way to back out of the history without clicking on an icon is to hit the Android Home or Back button.

2) Even if you press in a blank area on the history screen you end up selecting an app to open.

3) It would be nice if there was a default or an option to select to enable a zone about 20% of the right side of the screen where if you tap the blank area the history disappears to show you the main screen again, as if you hit the Home or Back button. 

4) So, tap screen to show history, tap right side 20% of screen to make the history disappear again without hitting Home or Back Button.

**5) Not sure if this should be a separate issue, but it could possibly make more sense to put the "Show history on touch" setting in "History settings" instead of "User experience" settings.**

I believe the updated one I would submit would help users more and efficiently. 


I would love to also write an about us to help users see the idea behind the creation of this project. I would love a reply to go ahead, once you like the write up you can merge.

I don't know if this can be done within KISS itself, or if a second codebase 'KISS Widget' will have to  be maintained. Food for thought.

title: Kiss crashes when the widget is updated from the Play Store
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When there's an update to the widget I use in Kiss, as in update to a newer version of the widget, Kiss crashes when the update is complete. I also have to set Kiss as default launcher again. This is not a big issue but annoying when using a widget that has frequent updates. 

* Kiss 3.1.0
* Android 7.0
* Moto G5+
* Using the Chronus widget

title: Feature request for "right and left swipe" gesture support
body:
I saw in the latest update that there are gestures now with KISS launcher. Up swipe for search and Down swipe for notifications , these work great on my Pixel XL 2.

Is there a way you could implement "right and left" gesture support?

I'd love to use the gestures to open specific apps (what I used to do with Action Launcher was map right swipe to Google Now to simulate the pixel launcher feature - I'd like to do that with KISS)

title: Ability to sort search engines
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: In my KISS Launcher, I have three custom search providers, ecosia, wordnik, and google play. By default, it searches wordnik when I type because that appears at the bottom. I think the ability to sort search engines or prioritize them would be useful

title: Proposal of logo and icon for the application
body:
Hello I would like to contribute with a new icon and logo for your application I leave you the proposal if you want to use it I can send you all the files.

![presentation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35604837/39029777-99c0a7b8-442b-11e8-9610-a91ddba14449.png)

title: Disable suggestions automatically when SwiftKey is detected as current input method
body: Removes the preference from the setting screen as this is now automatically detected.

title: Invalid primary color when using non rounded-bar pre Android Lollipop
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
On app v3.0,
Devices running Android 4.4,
Setting a primary color does not change the color of the KISS bar.

(color is correctly changed when using rounded bar, #860)

This was working correctly on v2.33.

Running a git bisect; this commit seems to be the first one introducing the regression: https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/commit/83a37fe6335495ee43e86cb67619931a108d9159

Everything works fine on Android L+, because the tinting works on background color:

https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/commit/83a37fe6335495ee43e86cb67619931a108d9159

title: [Feature Request] Backup for Kiss
body:
Hi,

I've been using Smart Launcher in the past which has a pretty complete backup, not perfect but a real time saver when moving the launcher to new phones or after factory reset. Would it be possible to create a backup mechanism for for Kiss? I have a ton of tags and my custom setup it would be great to be able to persevere. A little goes a long way so if at least tags could be backed up it would be great.

title: Built-in special tag support
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Build-in tags deal with the meta information of the entries. 

Imagine this:
- type "shortcut" to search all shortcuts
- type "new" to search all entries recently added
- type "trigger" to search all triggers
- and so on 

Is it desirable? 
It's a little bit like the auto-tag feature of the kiss launcher. Kiss launcher can already auto-tag clock, Google play, message and so on. So what about auto-taging **everything** with some useful meta tag?

title: Crash on widget add - Huawei Optimize
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
v3.0.9 F-Droid

Log: https://gist.github.com/licaon-kter/863ad0011751584c6e271ec20747635c

I guess the problem might be that the widget is provided by the Huawei Home Launcher, when selecting it in KISS it has the Home launcher icon, but a different one when adding it to the Home launcher.

title: Disable search bar
body: i often find myself only using the app drawer as i have very few apps on my device. so i don't use the search bar at all. an option to disable the search bar would be great. then i will not accidentally click within it & toggle my keyboard to pop-up.

title: Hide three dot menu button
body: i have a device with hardware buttons (galaxy note 3). i can access the menu by pressing my hardware menu button. so an option to hide the three dot menu button on devices with hardware buttons will be very useful.

title: Widget reset when switching launcher
label: [Label(name="require-more-information")]
body:
hi,

i use the latest version of KISS (3.0.12) on my oneplus one 7.1.2 sultan's version of LineageOS. when i change the default launcher and came back to KISS it resets the widget.

title: Fixing issue #946 (add search provider)
body:
Issue #946: If we cancel the dialog for search providers addition and show it again, the input texts are already added to the view so an exception is thrown. 

Fix: Remove the input texts and the layout from their parents before addition

title: Improvements on load time
body:
Recently, we spent a bunch of time optimizing search.

But hey, another big area of KISS is startup time. For most of us, we only see it once when we boot the device, but on some devices with low memory (or for gamers), the loading happens more frequently and can benefit from some optimizations.

## Overview
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178248-8f5757d2-3606-11e8-9ea0-caab71ddb6be.png)

AsyncTask#1 is the app loader,
AsyncTask#2 is the contact loader.

(might be interesting to try to make those calls in parallel to use multi-core when available, but that's something Android does on its own)

## Flamegraph: app loading
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178252-99ba632c-3606-11e8-97f8-38b38dbc8210.png)

A lot of time spent on system calls, not much to optimize here.
Notice the `normalizeWithResults` function, not a big drain but still here.

## Flamegraph: contact loading
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178258-c41c38f2-3606-11e8-83a3-c2c85c51fa07.png)

And with details:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178259-c8d96842-3606-11e8-8bee-8ab5e669e150.png)

A bunch of things that got optimized here:

* No more regexp in `PhoneNormalizer`. Regexps are slow, and in this case, we don't need them. (from 9% to 2.7%)
* We had two different simplifying regexp, for no reason. Phone uniqueness is now defined with the `simplifiedPhoneNumber`. (from 4.3% to 0%)

Notice the `normalizeWithResults` function, which accounts for 47% of the time.

## Flamegraph: `normalizeWithResults()`
As noticed before, this function gets called a lot by both AppLoader and ContactLoader.

Here is a zoom on the flamegraph:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178635-dc0155f8-360e-11e8-8496-421574dcbd88.png)

Actual numbers:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38178637-e4f98234-360e-11e8-9fec-9d7518db71fa.png)

The call to denormalize on NFKD is the most expensive one by far.

However, in most situations, we can assume that 80%+ of the characters will be basic latin characters (ASCII code < 'z'). So I've introduced a small `if` that short-circuit the normalizer whenever we're dealing with a basic Latin character (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters).

The Normalizer is not an easy-to-understand piece of code, and Unicode is really tricky for me, so I wasn't able to come up with anything more than that. It did, however, move the needle, as for ContactLoader `setName()` went from 47% of the time spent loading to 22%. The impact on AppLoader is less important as most of the time is still spent in system calls anyway.

----
**TL;DR**: contact load time improved by roughly 20%, app load time improved by roughly 5%.

title: Improve search algorithm / minimize GC stress
label: [Label(name="performance")]
body:
We've been discussing with @saveman71 to improve the search performance.

Right now, based on the flame graphs, we spend a lot of time allocating memory for storing positions:

https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/93367fcfceff8b7c524adde33d5f369422443389/app/src/main/java/fr/neamar/kiss/utils/FuzzyScore.java#L148-L154

In addition to this, every single Pojo in the app stores an ArrayList. If you have 5k contacts, that's 5k array lists created *for each search*, and 5k array lists *stored forever* (forever because KISS is never closed). OK, they're empty, but still, that's a lot.

The plan is to split the current algorithm into two independent parts:

* compute relevance, without storing the positions. This algorithm will run on every query and needs to be fast (and ideally, should make the garbage collector happy)
* compute highlighting, which we can delay until we're actually planning to display the results.

So, right now, when you search on your 1k contacts for the letter "a", assuming 700 contains the letter "a", we:

* go through 1000 items,
* generate 1000 array lists
* update 700 array lists on the Pojo
* display 5 of them on screen

And here is the associated flamegraph, zoomed on the relevant section:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38165258-a81f3202-3508-11e8-9229-2c0a2d743db0.png)

And here it is, unzoomed, on the search thread, provided for scale:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38165306-55365312-3509-11e8-9bb2-abc337bdbd30.png)

With values:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/38165351-df63a1fc-3509-11e8-85a7-f6eac0b8d2e0.png)

New plan:

* go through 1000 items,
* display 5 of them
* generate 5 array lists.

(expected improvements: remove the `Integer.valueOf()` subcall, remove the `ArrayList.<init>`, remove the `Integer.intValue`, so roughly 8% faster)

Current performance profile on an emulator (averaged across 500 runs):

* <history>: average 15.397590361445783ms
* a: average 13.302ms
* an: average 11.282ms
* ant: average 14.434ms
* anto: average 13.878ms
* antoi: average 14.118ms
* antoin: average 13.868ms
* antoine: average 13.986ms

<details>
<summary>Raw data</summary>
Code:

```python
import re
from collections import defaultdict

times = defaultdict(list)

with open("/tmp/logs") as f:
    content = f.readlines()
    content = [x.strip() for x in content]

    for line in content:
        matches = re.findall('`([<>a-z]+)`.+: ([0-9]+)ms', line)
        bucket = matches[0][0]
        time = int(matches[0][1])
        print(bucket, time)
        times[bucket].append(time)


def avg(numbers):
    return float(sum(numbers)) / len(numbers)


for t, v in times.items():
    print("%s: average %sms" % (t, avg(v)))

```

```java
    public void testPerf() {
        Matcher<View> s = withId(R.id.searchEditText);

        for (int i = 0; i < 500; i++) {
            try {
                onView(s).perform(replaceText("a"));
                Thread.sleep(50);
                onView(s).perform(replaceText("ab"));
                Thread.sleep(50);
                onView(s).perform(replaceText("abc"));
                Thread.sleep(50);
                onView(s).perform(replaceText(""));
            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }
    }
```
</details>

title: Use BaseAdapter instead of ArrayAdapter for performance
body:
While working on #890 I noticed that ArrayAdapter comes with a lot of features and we don't use a single one of them -- our use case is actually a very simple BaseAdapter.

The only thing I had to change was to implement the `public Object getItem(int position)` (one line!) and then I was able to remove unused constructor parameter and implement a function to replace results in one pass (instead of `.clear()` and `.addAll()`, which was triggering `notifyDatasetChanged()`.

`ArrayAdapter` was also thread safe, but since we're doing all our changes from the UI thread we don't need this.

I also removed the `refreshTask` (considered in #906, potentially useful for #937).

title: Do UI refresh from the refreshTask, rather than delaying it until next result
body:
The `addResult()` method is called nearly a thousand times per query on small queries, and in nearly all situations the `runCounter` will always be equal to the `counter`.
This commit moves the code for UI refresh on slow queries to the RefreshTask, making `addResult()` slightly faster (and maybe more readable, but I'm probably biased)

On queries with a lot of results (one letter query, see #894), this does shave a couple milliseconds off.

title: Calculator Feature
body: It would be nice if we could do four basic operations. For example, = 10 + 20 in response to the 30 results in the results field to show.

title: Keep database open as long as KISS is alive
body:
Fix #900.

Instead of opening / closing the database on every search, we open one (and only one) connection to the DB the first time we need it and keep it lying around in a static property in `DBHelper`.

If the GC needs to clean it, it will call `.finalize()` which will clean this properly.

More details on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4557154/android-sqlite-db-when-to-close

New flamegraph (see previous flamegraph on #900):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/37373814-2812aefa-2710-11e8-9300-cdd78e18f222.png)

(you'll notice that both flame graphs are subtly different even outside of the DB section, that's because I'm using a random sampler and do not get a perfectly accurate representation of time spent in functions) 

Expected gain: (hard to quantify exactly) 15% on all searches!

However the latter doesn't show up in KISS. As I do not have this problem with any other app I can only assume that it is because they are labelled the same in the launcher.

Also, thank you for creating this excellent launcher :D

EDIT: The above theory is wrong. Any new app - regardless of name - is not being appearing in the launcher.

title: Faster search for one letter query
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="performance")]
body:
KISS search got much better over the last version, but it's slower in general and much slower for one letter query.

This might just be because a lot of providers return all their Pojo at once (if you type "a", 80% of your app will contain this letter).

I think we might be able to improve performance somehow -- maybe by not returning relevance < 0 for one letter query, or simply by not using the advanced search algorithm when there is only a one-letter query.

--- | ---
Transparent White | lighter shade of grey
(Semi &) White | darker shade of grey

On the physical keyboard for the Pixel C, whenever I press the search/home key (like on a Chromebook), or try to search directly from the home screen, KISS errors on text input. This is new as of 1 March. I've tried reinstalling the current KISS version from F-Droid and from the Google Play Store - neither has worked. All I get is this error message:

title: [Feature Request] Sort search results by type
body:
Currently, KISS sorts search results by alphabetical order only, what I'm proposing is that it should also sort results by type (e.g. web search, apps, contacts, etc), why do I feel this is important?, well first of all, consistency, but most importantly, this button right here:

![screenshot_2018-03-06-03-50-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34275299/37020382-ee41a1be-20f1-11e8-8d8c-dea44e96735c.png)

Not sure how it's called, I'll call it the "go" button. When you press it it selects the closest match (aka the lowest result in the list), in the picture, web search is the closest match (for whatever reason), this is not the same for all apps though, but in Nova I'd just type the first two letters of an app, comfortably press the "go" button, and it'd always open an app (because it's the only thing nova searches for), I can't do that on KISS, at least not without giving up web search, being able to set priorities on search results would solve that.

title: Lint
body:

Fixing the ones that can be fixed, adding `@SuppressLint` for stuff not relevant to KISS.

Lint got us to remove one RelativeLayout completely in the main layout, so that's always a good thing!

title: Search treats whitespace as too significant
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When searching in KISS, a space on the end will remove items which match at the end of the item's name.

As an example, when I search for "Maps" it will correctly display the "Maps" application. When I search for "Maps " it will fail to display the "Maps" application.

This is particularly annoying because my keyboard adds a space after the word when I select one of the autocorrect options.

I only noticed this issue occurring in the most recent release, so I assume it is related to the changelog entry noting "Completely revamped search algorithm".

I am running KISS from F-Droid, version 2.33.1, on LineageOS 14.1 (Android 7.1.2), on a Galaxy S4. If there's any other information that you need let me know.

title: Remove portrait mode option (fix #535)
body:
As discussed in #535, every Android device since Lollipop has an easy way to lock / unlock rotation.

There is no need to provide such a feature at the app level anymore.

title: Fix for #710
body:

title: SDK update
body:
This PR aims to bring KISS into the future by targetting SDK 27.

Will fix #350 and #771.

Added:

* Permission management (required for SDK 23+). When opening the app for the first time, the app will ask for contact permission. When touching the phone button for the first time, the app will ask for phone permission. And in the settings, enabling "sms history" or "phone call history" will also ask for permission, and handle the case where the user actually denies this permission.
* data handler has to be initialized from MainActivity, since Service can't be started anymore when the app is in background (and `Application.onCreate()` is considered background)
* removed all redundant type casting that are not required anymore

title: Adding homescreen tabs
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Hello. First of all let me say I'm really grateful for adding KLWP support. It's pretty much perfect launcher for me right now. Then I thought about one thing, kinda related to KLWP and all. Many of people using Live Wallpapers have multiple screens for different setup. Something like calendar and stuff on the left, "main thing" in the center and some custom music tab on the right. So I was wondering if you could implement feature to add more screens on homepage? It would be really nice thing to have, it would also benefit widget users as sometimes they need a bit more space for them.

title: Round contact badges
body:
I remember we had a request to fix the rounded contact badges.
I can't test this PR on other phones right now, but it should work.

## Issue
When scrolling the result list with contacts that have no image set, the default icon will flicker between rounded and square.
I for one had this issue on SGS8+ forever.

## Solution
We used to make the badge round using canvas.clipPath but this is known to have issues with hardware acceleration. The solution I found was to use a rounded rectangle and mask it onto the image using the porter-duff Xfer mode of the paint.

Will fix #760.

Toggles had a long and happy life, but it's time to move to 2018.

By now, all the toggles have been either removed from Android, they have to use hacks to work (because Android made them private), or have been superseded by new notifications bar and quick tiles.

title: KISS should ideally have no theming
body:
In my opinion theming distracts from the purpose of the launcher. I'm sure the issue of the launcher obfuscating the wallpaper has been mentioned before, and I'm sure some have complained about the text being obfuscated by the wallpaper.

I propose a removal of the theming for all but the search bar and app drawer. The text should then be changed to have a small drop shadow like most other launchers to make it easier to read.

This in my opinion would fix some design disadvantages I see with KISS, and reduce the setup time that it takes to try out which theme works. I also see this achieving KISS's goals more then what its like now.

title: Improved startup time
body:
Improved startup time:

* When running DEBUG builds, ensure AppProvider only loads once (there was a bug where the sytemn would notify KISS that a package was changed [KISS itself], triggering a useless reload)

title: Stop storing Android context in static fields
body:
This issue has been here since day 1...

Back then, I didn't know how to code for Android (not much has changed since then!)

The DataHandler was static, and that way everyone had access to it.

Turns out that pretty much every single class needs it, and the DataHandler needs the context for various tasks and services.

This means the context was stored in a static field, and that's BAD DESIGNâ„¢ (especially since the context was often an instance of MainActivity...)

This PR finally uses the "standard" Android Application class overrides, and store everything on the application.

It would be nice to add a feature to pick text color. This would then be used to display results and the search query.

title: Forwarder pattern
body:
## Why
Over time, `MainActivity` became more and more bloated with unrelated concerns. Right now, it's a behemoth --- 1200 lines of code dealing with UI, widgets, search, favorites, keyboards and app list.

This makes onboarding new contributors harder than required, and leads to confusion ("do we still need this line of code? Why is it used, under which situations and for which settings"?)

## What
To solve this problem, I'm trying to implement a Forwarder pattern (think Delegation).

Roughly speaking, there is a `ForwarderManager`. The `MainActivity` will call the `ForwarderManager` during certain lifecycle events (more can be defined easily). In turn, the manager will forward the call to any interested subclass of `Forwarder`.

Strictly speaking, the manager should ignore the business logic of every Forwarder, but for performance reasons, I'd rather manually call any function that has to be called (rather than loop over each Forwarder). An interesting side effect is that a Forwarder can access the ForwarderManager and communicate with other forwarders if it needs it.

## Will it change anything?
If I manage to do this properly, then nothing will change. There will be more lines of code, but the MainActivity will be easier to understand and features should be properly contained within their Forwarder.

## Which forwarder will we have?
I'm just getting started, but so far I'd say:

- [x] Widget forwarder
- [x] Wallpaper forwarder
- [x] Favorites forwarder
- [x] UI forwarder (for all the UI tweaks)
- [x] UX forwarder (for all the UX tweaks)

It's unclear yet how relevant it would be to create forwarders for more "core features" (all apps list? history?)

---
If there is any Java guru, I'm interested in their opinion; this might be a terrible idea. Open to suggestions!

(for those interested: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forwarding_(object-oriented_programming))
# QA test suite
This document contains a small QA suite that can be run after big changes to the app.
As best as possible, only actual KISS code is tested, not standard Android system behavior.

# QA test suite
This document contains a small QA suite that can be run after big changes to the app.
As best as possible, only actual KISS code is tested, not standard Android system behavior.

> This document assumes all settings are at their default value when you start

### Get started...
* [x] Loader appears when opening the app
* [x] Help text appears while app is loading
* [x] After some time, loader disappears and is replaced by launcher icon
* [x] Searching for text displays results
* [x] Clicking the launcher displays the list of apps
* [x] History is displayed when search box is empty
* [x] When clicking on a search item, the corresponding intent is triggered
* [x] When going back to KISS, search results have been cleared
* [x] When going back to KISS, the item has been added to history
* [x] Three dots menu is displayed to the right
* [x] Entering a search query replaces the three-dots menu with an "X"
* [x] Clicking the "X" empties the search field, displays three dots menu and displays help text
* [x] When searching, pressing enter on the keyboard launches the first result
* [x] When keyboard is displayed, scrolling the list down hides the keyboard
* [x] When searching, pressing space as the first character does nothing (left-hand side trimming)
* [x] Press kiss icon. App list is displayed, and kiss bar appears with a circular reveal animation
* [x] Press kiss icon again. App list is hidden, and kiss bar disappears with a circular (un)reveal animation
* [x] With keyboard open, press kiss icon. App list is displayed, and keyboard stays there
* [x] With keyboard open, press kiss icon. The app list is displayed. When typing something on the keyboard, app list is hidden, and search results start appearing
* [x] Search for something, press kiss icon. The app list is displayed. Press kiss icon again, search query has been emptied
* [x] With KISS set as default launcher, pressing home empties the search field and displays history
* [x] With KISS set as default launcher and app list displayed, pressing home hides the app list and displays history
* [x] When app bar is displayed, pressing back hides the bar and displays history
* [x] When search results are displayed, pressing back empties then search field and displays history
* [x] When history is displayed, pressing back does not quit KISS
* [x] When searching for something, touching the edit text moves the cursor

#### Menus
* [x] Clicking the three dots menu open a popup
* [x] Long-clicking the three dots menu open a popup
* [ ] If device has physical menu button, pressing menu displays the three-dots menu
* [x] Long pressing a search result displays contextual menu
* [x] When clicking three dots menu, pressing back dismisses the popup

### History
#### Standard history manipulation
* [x] Reset history preference displays number of items in history if history length > 5
* [x] Reset history clears existing history instantly
* [x] Reset history summary does not display the old history length after reset
* [x] Pressing cancel on reset history does not reset history
* [x] Adding an excluded app hides the app from search results
* [x] Adding an excluded app hides the app from history
* [x] Adding an excluded app hides the app from app list
* [x] Resetting excluded app removes all excluded apps
* [x] Resetting excluded apps allows apps previously hidden to be displayed in app list
* [x] No more than Max number of results in search is displayed to the user
* [x] Changing the value updates the history dynamically
* [x] Freezing history prevents new items from being added to history
* [x] Unchecking "Freeze history" ensures history is populated again
* [ ] TODO: history mode

#### Automated history
* [x] When "Show incoming SMS" is disabled, SMS senders are not added to history
* [x] When "Show incoming SMS" is enabled, SMS senders are added to history
* [ ] When "Show incoming calls" is disabled, callers are not added to history
* [ ] When "Show incoming calls" is enabled, callers are added to history
* [x] When "Show newly installed apps" is disabled, new apps are not added to history
* [x] When "Show newly installed apps" is enabled, new apps are added to history

### Favorites
* [x] Favorite bar is displayed automatically at startup
* [x] Clicking on a favorite trigger the correct Intent
* [x] When going back to KISS, the favorite has been added to history
* [x] Long-clicking favorite displays the menu
* [x] Long-click menu can be used to remove the favorite
* [x] Empty favorites are not displayed (favorites takes all available space in the bar)
* [x] When entering a search query, favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When search query is removed, bar appears again
* [x] When coming back from an application launched through search, bar is displayed again
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites are displayed
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, internal favorites bar is hidden
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, you can't click on the menu button behind the kiss bar (not even visible, doesn't respond to touch events either)
* [x] When searching and pressing home, query is cleared, and favorites are displayed
* [x] When adding a favorite, it appears automatically, and favorites are evenly spaced
* [x] When removing a favorite, it disappears automatically, and favorites are evenly spaced
* [x] When viewing the search list and adding an application to favorites, the app list remains visible and the favorite appears
* [x] When searching and adding a result to favorites, the search remains visible and the favorite appears

#### Minimalistic mode on for favorites
* [x] In settings, UX, enable Minimalistic mode and Minimalistic mode for favorites
* [x] Favorites bar is hidden by default
* [x] Touching the screen on an empty area displays history and the favorites
* [x] When entering a search query, favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When search query is removed, favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When searching and pressing home, favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When coming back from an application launched through search, favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites are displayed

#### When using the internal favorite bar
* [x] In settings, Favorites settings, disable "Show favorites above search bar", disable Minimalistic mode and Minimalistic mode for favorites
* [x] The external favorite bar is hidden by default
* [x] When entering a search query, external favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When search query is removed, external favorite bar is still hidden
* [x] When coming back from an application launched through search, external favorite bar is hidden
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites are visible in the kiss bar
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites can be clicked
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites can be long-clicked
* [x] When kiss bar is opened, favorites' context menu can be interacted with

#### When using the external favorite bar, with transparent favorite bar
* [x] In settings, Favorites settings, enable "Show favorites above search bar". In UI, enable "Transparent favorite bar"
* [x] The bar background is transparent


#### When using the internal favorite bar, with transparent favorite bar
* [x] In settings, Favorites settings, disable "Show favorites above search bar". In UI, enable "Transparent favorite bar"
* [x] The bar background is *not* transparent, but still green.

#### First run
* [x] On the first run, favorites are set by default (browser, contact, and phone)

### UI
#### Theming
* [x] Picking a theme in the settings updates the settings UI (light or dark)
* [x] Picking a theme in the settings updates the main screen theme
* [x] Loader circle is properly tinted according to the primary color
* [x] Launcher icon is properly tinted according to the primary color
* [x] KISS bar background is properly tinted according to the primary color
* [x] Notification bar is of the selected color on the main screen theme

#### Icons pack
* [ ] TODO: theme icon packs

#### General UI
* [x] Transparent search bar is displayed transparent
* [x] Large search bar is... large
* [x] When using large search bar and internal favorites bar, favorites are scaled appropriately
* [x] When using large search bar and internal favorites bar, kiss bar is scaled appropriately (same height as search field)

### UX
#### Keyboard
* [x] Disable keyboard on start
* [x] Press home. Keyboard is not displayed
* [x] Press back. Keyboard is not displayed
* [x] Display app list. Hide app list, keyboard is not displayed
* [x] Touch search field. Keyboard is displayed
* [x] Open a search result. Press home, keyboard is not displayed
* [x] Open a search result. Press back, keyboard is not displayed
* [x] Enable keyboard on start
* [x] Press home. Keyboard is displayed
* [x] Display app list. Hide keyboard. Hide app list, keyboard is displayed
* [x] Open a search result. Press home, keyboard is displayed
* [x] Open a search result. Press back, keyboard is displayed
* [x] (using Swiftkey keyboard) Disable "keyboard suggestions fix". Keyboard displays suggestions when typing
* [x] (using Swiftkey keyboard) Enable "keyboard suggestions fix". Keyboard does not display suggestions when typing

#### Minimalistic mode
* [x] When using minimalistic mode and pressing home, history is not displayed
* [x] When using minimalistic mode and pressing the search bar, history is not displayed
* [x] When using minimalistic mode and pressing anywhere else, history is not displayed
* [x] When using minimalistic mode with history-touch and pressing anywhere else (outside of a widget), history is displayed
* [x] When scrolling down on the history, the keyboard disappears
* [x] When using immersive mode for the notification bar, notification bar disappears when pressing home
* [x] When using immersive mode for the notification bar, notification bar appears when searching for a text
* [x] When using immersive mode for the navigation bar, navigation bar disappears when pressing home

##### Widgets
* [x] When using minimalistic mode, the three dot menu has an option to Add a widget
* [x] Selecting the option displays a list of all available widgets
* [x] Selecting a widget displays the widget when history is empty
* [x] Widget is hidden when displaying app list
* [x] Widget is hidden when searching
* [x] When opening a search result and pressing back, Widget is displayed
* [x] When opening a search result and pressing home, Widget is displayed
* [x] Clicking on the widget opens the widget app
* [x] Clicking outside of the widget with history-touch replace the widget with history

#### Portrait / landscape
* [x] When portrait-locked, app can't pivot
* [x] When not locked, app can pivot
* [x] When not locked and searching, app can pivot and search remains
* [x] When not locked and viewing app list, app can pivot and app list remains available

#### Apps
* [x] App list is displayed alphabetically when A-Z is selected in "App list sort order"
* [x] App list is displayed in reverse order when Z-A is selected in "App list sort order"
* [x] With show app tags enabled, long press an app and add a tag. Tag is displayed
* [x] Search for the tag you just added, app is displayed and tag is highlighted
* [x] With show app tags disabled, long press an app and add a tag. Tag is not displayed
* [x] Search for the tag you just added, the app is displayed with matching tag
* [x] With hide app icons disabled, app icons are displayed
* [x] With hide app icons enabled, app icons are not displayed (empty space)

#### Wallpaper
* [x] Wallpaper reacts to touch events
* [ ] TODO: drag events

### Providers settings
* [x] Search for a contact. Make sure it is displayed as a result and appended to history on click
* [x] Search for a device setting. Make sure it is displayed as a result and appended to history on click
* [x] Search for a toggle. Make sure it is displayed as a result and appended to history on click
* [x] Search for a phone number. Make sure it is displayed as a result and appended to history on click
* [ ] Search for a shortcut (you'll probably need to create one from an app first, for instance, WhatsApp). Make sure it is displayed as a result and appended to history on click
* [x] Search for a long test. Make sure a web search option is displayed as a result
* [x] From Providers selection, disable Contacts. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search or history
* [x] From Providers selection, disable Device settings. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search or history
* [x] From Providers selection, disable Toggles. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search or history
* [x] From Providers selection, disable Phone numbers. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search or history
* [ ] From Providers selection, disable Shortcuts. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search or history
* [x] From Providers selection, disable Web Search. From now on, they are not displayed anymore in search
* [x] Add a search provider. Ensure it is available in the select search provider setting
* [x] Select a search provider. Ensure it is available in search
* [x] Reset search providers. Ensure only default providers are visible
* [x] Delete a search provider. Ensure it is not available in search anymore
* [x] Disable search providers. Enter a query with no results. Help text is displayed.
* [x] Disable search providers. Enable minimalistic mode. Enter a query with no results. Nothing is displayed

### Advanced settings
* [x] Change default launcher option opens system dialog to pick a launcher
* [ ] TODO: root mode
* [x] "Restart KISS" option closes the settings and reopen KISS

### Misc

title: Reorganize settings
body:
KISS settings grew quite large over time. In particular, the User Interface screen became a melting pot of various options.

While writing documentation for http://help.kisslauncher.com I noticed some settings were not placed in the most logical sub-screen.

This PR:

* splits User interface in two: "User interface" for things related to design (example: theming), and "User experience" for things related to how you interact with KISS (example: displaying keyboard on start)
* adds a new sub-screen, "Favorites settings", for settings related to... well, favorites.
* adds summaries for the subscreens settings

## After
![2018-02-18 14 42 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/536844/36353095-fe784c02-14b9-11e8-9096-129674dedea0.png)

title: Popup does not get dismissed quickly
body:
2.32.5 F-Droid

Steps:
* Long press on an app
* Popup appears
* 1 (while it is on) long press on another app
* 2 (while it is on) try to scroll the app list
* 3 (while it is on) touch the kiss bar

Expected result:
* Popup gets dismissed from the first app
* 1 appears on the second one
* 2 list scrolls
* 3 kiss bar triggered, eg. Show keyboard

Actual result:
* Popup stays on the first app
* 1 After I stop touching the second app the popup disappears (not always!) and now I need to touch it **again** to get its popup
* 2 I need to touch the kiss bar to dismiss it and then I can scroll
* 3 the kiss bar does not trigger but it only dismisses the app popup...and then you need to touch kiss bar **again** to be able to write.

Ping @TBog

title: Documentation update
body:
KISS has evolved over the years to include an extensive list of settings, some of which enable arcane behavior that might not be super easy to understand for the novice.

While powerful, it can also be quite daunting to the new user.

During those years, KISS has evolved but not the website. I was thinking about adding some kind of "FAQ" or "documentation" on how to customize KISS for your use case, and to understand the various settings. This might take some time, but probably not that much. I'm checking to see if anyone would be interested in helping -- doesn't need to write HTML, it's probably going to be plain markdown files that will then be translated to HTML.

If anyone has interest, please comment here and we can try to synchronize all together on what need to be done and how we can do it.

title: ListView inflates more items than actually required
label: [Label(name="performance")]
body:
When displaying the history for instance,

All items are inflated, even the ones currently not displayed on-screen.

This has a big performance impact, especially at startup, since every time a provider finishes loading everything is reloaded again.

In my case, my history contains 20 items. When I start KISS, I load 120 items (20 items * 6 providers).

This should be 9 items (I can't display more on screen)

title: Another attempt at fixing app flickering
body:
Related to #801.

Looking at #801, I'm wondering if we're talking about the same thing, or if maybe my device behaves in a weird way.

I'll explain what I'm trying to fix *here*, and then we can decide if that was indeed the same issue or just me misunderstanding what "flicker" meant.

In my case, when searching for apps, for a couple ms (just enough for the eye to register) the app icon displayed will be the same as the app in the same position just before. For instance, if my history contains "Google Search" and I search for "Whatsapp", for the shortest amount of time I'll see the text "Whatsapp" with the "Google Search" image.

The same thing happens, for instance, when moving from the history to the app list (provided minimal history is disabled and open keyboard on start is off too, otherwise everything moves and it's hard to tell what's happening).

Another interesting thing is that, sometimes, for reasons probably related to the lazy loading of providers, the app will be refreshed with the exact same Results (let's say, for instance, I only have apps in my history, then the contact provider finishes to load and all the images are displayed again).

This fix will:

* Ensure no loading happens if the image currently displayed is already the one we'd load (for instance, when you launch an app, history is refreshed in the background which sometimes caused the app icon to disappear/reappear)
* Ensure the image currently used is cleared as soon as the record is displayed on screen
* Remove the current caching strategy

title: Change Application Icons Manually
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
The main reason I think this would be useful is because a lot of icon packs don't apply the icons to certain applications unless the name is exactly the same.

For example, with the browser Lightning, only the generic Play Store version gets the icon changed and not the Lightning+/F-Droid version.
Other launchers such as Nova have this option to manually change the icon but I've noticed that KISS does not, even though it's superior in every other conceivable way.

Hopefully I'm not the only one that would be interested in this and it will be implemented in the future.

title: If app with emoji name is installed, typing into search bar crashes
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
On my phone, KISS's AppProvider is crashing whenever I type into the search bar. Uninstalling Image Analysis Toolset, an app with emoji in the app-drawer name (but not the Settings name), then KISS Settings/Advanced/Restart fixes this crash.

```
java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occurred while executing doInBackground()
	at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:318)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.finishCompletion(FutureTask.java:354)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:223)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:242)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1133)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:607)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:761)
Caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 9
	at java.lang.String.codePointAt(String.java:602)
	at fr.neamar.kiss.dataprovider.AppProvider.getResults(AppProvider.java:169)
	at fr.neamar.kiss.searcher.QuerySearcher.doInBackground(QuerySearcher.java:1263)
	at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:304)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237)
	... 3 more
```

I discovered that the "Scoop" Xposed module automatically captures stack traces into your notifications. It's really helpful and I would recommend it for everyone.

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:

I got a report that there was an error, here is the video:
[video.mp4.zip](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/files/1620611/video.mp4.zip)

By the look of it, they were trying to reset the search providers.

```
Issue: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void fr.neamar.kiss.dataprovider.SearchProvider.reload()' on a null object reference
FATAL EXCEPTION: ControllerMessenger
```

title: adding support for tags on shortcuts
body:
As mentioned in #714 , the user can now add tags on shortcuts and search shortcuts based on tags.

I actually moved all the relevant tags code from the Apps (AppPojo, AppResult) to the parent classes.
So in the future adding support for tags to other providers should be more straight forward. 

However, there is some code duplication between apps and shortcuts that I might try to remove in the future.

title: Removing Settings and Toggle
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Hey there!

I'm thinking about completely removing the Settings and Toggle providers from the app.

They take a lot of code and don't bring a lot of value according to me, since all the features are now easily available in the notification bar for any device post-2012.

Back in time (Android Froyo! I think that was 1.6?), they were really nice and shiny, but now I never use them.

Some of them had bugs forever (not synced with system state, flashlight not always working on every device), and some of them were killed by the OS (Android won't let an app enable GPS easily anymore).

Anyone think they should stay in the app?

title: Changes required to KISS before November 2018
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Hey there,

By November 2018, every app will be required to target the latest version of Android.

This will be a big issue for KISS, since we're still targeting a very old SDK to "avoid" permission issues introduced in recent versions of Android.

See https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2017/12/improving-app-security-and-performance.html
We'll need to think about it...

title: Plugin/extension support
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I found a lot of comments in issue tracker about plugin support but there isn't any specific thread for it.

I think that plugin support is a good way to keep KISS simple and lightweight and at the same time it's a good way to add a lot of functionality.

Moreover plugins would keep a low number of permissions request. These permission would be required for each single plugin (e.g. would be also possible to remove contacts permission and make it available in a Contact plugin).

For example with plugins would be possible to add particular search provider such as:

- search files
- currency/units converter
- simple math
- specific app task (e.g. typing "addnote buy bread" add a new note in a specific note app that support KISS plugins)
- etc...

(I have no skills in this field so I do not know exactly how plugins work. So it's possible I said something wrong).

Some related issues: #592, [#592 (comment)](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/issues/592#issuecomment-269926459), #486, #390, #673.

I think this should be a priority feature to add in KISS.

I saw that @alexander255 was working on it some times ago.
Is there still someone who is working on this?

body:
KISS is certainly the best launcher out here in the wild. I readed the contribute file, but nothing about building the repo was written there, nor in readme. I don't know about Android at all, only thing i know is it uses some sort of Java, if i am correct. So, i want to help if i can, but i don't know how. I would love some guides or tutorials.

Thanks for making this great launcher, the only one i like.

title: Support Android 8 (Oreo) shortcut creation
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I understand from #173 that shortcuts (links added from a browser using "Add to Home Screen") should appear in the KISS search results.  This might apply only to new shortcuts made after KISS was installed (#748).

However, the KISS launcher seems to be unable to create shortcuts on Android 8.

Using Android 8.0.0, in the Google Now launcher, I can create shortcuts from Chrome. The usual process works:

1. Select Add home screen.
2. The "name the shortcut" dialog appears so I select Add.
3. A widget dialog appears so I press OK.
4. The shortcut appears on my home screen.

It works in Firefox Focus too.

Now I go to Settings and set the home screen to KISS. If I try the add shortcut process above, I get only 1 and 2: The "widget" dialog never appears. Same in Firefox Focus.

Presumably, versions of KISS targeted at Android 8 and above should use [ShortcutManager.requestPinShortcut()](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/pm/ShortcutManager.html#requestPinShortcut(android.content.pm.ShortcutInfo,%20android.content.IntentSender))

The versions I tested:
KISS version 2.31.4
Android 8.0.0
Chrome 62.0.3202.84
Firefox Focus 2.5

Since version 2.31.2 copy / paste on the search bar is not working. It is also not possible to select text on it. Behaviour still present in 2.31.3.

## To reproduce:
1. Copy some text into the clipboard.
2. Have KISS as your default launcher (or otherwise activate it)
3. Press the home button or otherwise bring up the home screen
4. Ensure the search bar is showing in KISS, as in the following illustration: ![screenshot_20171113-154231](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13080040/32731278-adf45fc2-c889-11e7-82ed-dc4860af9c07.png)
5. Long-press in the search bar.

### What actually happens

Nothing at all â˜¹

### What I expect

The â€œpasteâ€ menu is brought up, and by tapping the relevant option, the user can paste text into the search bar.

Likewise, if some text is already present in the search bar, it is not possible to select it and copy it.

title: Reuse existing results for query refinements
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="performance")]
body:
Pretty much all of the providers could be optimized the following way.

For example, for the `AppProvider` we iterate over each AppPojo and return the results. Usually, if the user adds character to the query, we won't return AppPojo we already did not match for the previous query.

We could then exclude the not matched pojos on the previous query while running the current query when we are actually "specifying" it more.

Maybe it has some side effects I did not think of, what do you think? Any particular way you're thinking that's best for implementing it?
