title: Favorites bar ON by default with default dialer, contacts and browser preselected
body:
Hi all,
A few months ago, we had a short discussion (offline) regarding the favorites bar above search and default favorites after first installation of KISS.

In this PR, the favorites bar is set to ON by default (the user can of course disable it in settings).
Also, on first run (detected by a flag on shared preferences + history.size == 0) the default dialer, contact app and browser are set as favorites. 

A screenshot after installation of KISS:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7504889/30768881-40ab9b80-a00f-11e7-9606-d49af8d8a2e6.png)

I think it creates a better first time experience. Any opinions are welcome

PS: On the downside: I am adding some further chaos inside MainActivity.java... :-/

title: [BUG] Calling from a Dual SIM phone is not handled properly
body:
**Description of the problem**
Using Kiss Launcher on a dual SIM smartphone (Mate 9 with Android 7.0 in my case), when calling someone, the call starts without giving the user the opportunity to choose which sim to dial from.

**How to reproduce**
* Enter the name of a contact in the search bar
* Tap on the left-right phone icon in front of the contact name

Alternatively, you can enter a number with the keyboard and tap the phone icon as well

**What is happening**
The phone activity is launched directly calling the contact from the first sim card.

**What should happen**
The user should be asked for which SIM card he would like to call from.

title: Regarding "Slide Launcher Pro"
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
(followup from a discussion on #369)

**tl;dr**: There is an app selling a modified KISS version on the Play Store. KISS is GPL. They claim they published it while it was still MIT. But they have new features. Anyone with legal knowledge on the topic?

-----

Play Store link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.plh.note7slide

Since KISS licence is GPL, I sent this first email:

```
Hi,

I'm Neamar on Github, owner of the https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/ repository on which Slide Launcher is based.

Kiss licence is GNU/GPL v3.

Although you're more than welcome to create your own fork of the project and add features, you also need to comply with the project's original licence at https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/master/LICENSE

You're allowed to sell the project if you want to, but in your case, you also need to:

* Open source the changes you built on top of KISS (grid view, etc.)
* Ensure that you mention the original project is KISS. A link in your Play Store description should be enough.

Thanks for your attention, congrats on your changes -- looking forward to seeing them online :)
```

After this email, the description for the PRO version (not the standard one) was updated to mention "Neamar/Kiss" in text (no link). The lite version doesn't mention anything, but in the app, settings, legal, you can see "Â© Matthieu Bacconnier 2015" -- that's my name, but I never had any Â© on KISS.

I had no reply to my email, but @eevleevs contacted them, saw they didn't want to change anything and reminded me of the problem. So I sent another email:

```
Hello again,

I noticed that you changed the description in the Store, thanks. I'd appreciate if you could make it a link, either to the Play Store or Github.

However, you haven't open-sourced your changes, which is the second requirement from the GPL licence.

It also looks like in discussions with other persons, you failed to mention you had already been asked to publish the source code.

Please do it before next Friday (that will give you a month of notice since my first email), since respecting the license will mean a better ecosystem for everyone's app -- plus, as you make money out of the app, it's only fair that you comply with the legal requirements.

Thanks for your attention again. Hopefully, I won't have to send another mail next week...
```

This time, I got an answer, asking me "how to open-source", and claiming that Slide Launcher was on the Store while KISS was still MIT (July 3rd, 2016 https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/commit/1443adc77a89d4ec5dde3e0378d0da06b626b682).

A quick look at the app, which is very similar to KISS indeed, let me think they've incorporated features published in KISS since then (color change at least), and from my understanding of GPL the licence is sticky which means that by pulling part of the code they agree to publish all of the code.

Anyone here with some legal knowledge on the matter? Would like to double check I'm correct before asking for Play Store arbitration.

title: Don't updateThemePrimaryColor on SettingsActivity
body:
SettingsActivity shouldn't receive its actionbar (or statusbar) colour from
updateThemePrimaryColor. Using the method only changes the colour of the
first page of Settings, it doesn't apply anywhere else in the activity.
This means that other pages of Settings will have the default green
colour while the first page has the colour set from
updateThemePrimaryColor.

title: Adding support from custom search providers
body:
A solution for #538 and #553 
The user is able to add, delete, select and reset custom search providers.

I use 3 StringSets in preferences:
- deleting-search-providers-names to store the providers to be delete
- available-search-providers to store all search providers in the format <name|url>
- selected-search-provider-names to store the names of the selected providers

When a user adds or deletes a provider, I have to remove the 2 multipreferences and add them again so that they are up to date.

Known issues: 
- When adding a search provider, the text might not be visible depending on the selected theme. 

This PR might increase the size of the app since I use 11 strings

Tested on android 7.1.1

title: Swatch-based color picker
body:
As featured in [#631](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/631#issuecomment-289618499), I've created a color swatch (who would have guessed that name!?) based color picker for KISS:

![screenshot_20170405-144722](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/246386/24706323/90b4c600-1a0f-11e7-936e-3040ce9e924e.png)

The actual code for drawing the color swatches is from the Android framework (not part of the SDK unfortunately) and has been imported as a GIT submodule (~400eLoC, of which about 3/4 are used in our case). This code also requires at least Android 4.0.3 (instead of just Android 4.0.0), from what I've gettered we are actually an exception for not jumping directly to that version when dropping 2.3, so hopefully it should be fine.

title: Shortcut disappear
body: I had a few home screen shortcuts created by Firefox. When Firefox got updated all the shortcuts disappeared. Same happened with Telegram.

title: Exclude favorites from history
body: Opening an item (app, contact, etc.) through a favorite should not show the item in the history. Otherwise the item appears twice on screen, taking valuable space for no reason.

title: [Feature Request] Possibility to rearrange favourites.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: This would be nice since now you have to favourite things in the right order to put them how you want.

title: Ui tweaker
body:
Lets you change the main color.

This is the currently most complained about feature in the Play Store: a lot of people hate the green bar.

This PR builds on previous work I did on #630, but a lot has changed since then, especially with the dropped support of older SDKs.

Changing the main color will:

* change kiss logo color
* change standard favorite bar background color
* change phone and messaging icon on contacts
* change highlight color in search result
* change notification bar color (Android L and above only)
* Change action bar color in settings (but not in subscreens for some reason?)

The following won't change, because they're too complex to manage (or I'm too stupid [lazy?] to figure out how to do it):

* loading spinner indicator when opening app for the first time
* toggle color in Toggle search results (and in KISS settings)
* cursor color in search box

Needs to be tested on Android < L before merge.

Left to do:

* [x] Use defined color on MainActivity and Results
* [x] Let primary color and notification color be different if you want to (e.g. transparent notification bar while still using KISS green)
* [x] Add semi-transparent black in the color list
* [x] Hide notification bar color pre-L
* [x] Try to display the colors directly in the DialogPicker, instead of using their english names
* [x] No immediate restart

title: Notification bar color
body: Remnants of an old age. PR not to be merged.

title: New tags not appearing in search
body: I just upgraded to 2.29.2 from fdroid.org and then added a tag to an app. When I search that tag the latter doesn't appear in the results but the others do. I have 10 apps under that tag.

title: Keyboard typing issue
body:
Sometimes typing on the search bar has no effect .  The problem is shown in the attached video.
[Screenrecorder-2017-03-17-07-46-56-299.zip](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/files/851169/Screenrecorder-2017-03-17-07-46-56-299.zip)

title: shortcuts dissapear in a given time
body:
I often create many shortcuts from the apps to search for them from the launcher. For instance, some web pages or whatsapp chats.
First when I create them, I can find them from the launcher search, but, after some time -I guess that is when Android itself decides to liberate ram -, the shortcuts I created before are not searchable anymore, they aren't in the all apps list neither.

I don't know if this is an actual bug, nor if there is an upcoming update with this "issue" fixed.
Thank you very much. 

PS. Maybe an option to freeze the launcher with an aggressive mode as nova has could be a solution? Although I think that "shortcuts tracker" or something like that would be a better option because when the app relaunches, it can read it again. But those are just ideas because I have no idea how the Android's shortcuts API actually works, if there is such an API.

title: Should be String
body: `toast_favorites_removed` uses `%s` for all other languages. Thus, the linter barfed when it found it using `%d`.

title: Excluded apps keep reappearing
body: ...when updated directly via APKs at least.

title: Shortcuts issues
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Using [QuickShortcut](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.sika524.android.quickshortcut) or [Island](https://forum.xda-developers.com/android/apps-games/closed-beta-test-incoming-companion-app-t3366295) to make one I get:
* Shortcut is not in used apps list on creation (not like installing a new app)
* Shortcut is not in all apps list
* Shortcut magically appears only on search
* Shortcut has only 2 options on long press: add to favs and delete
* Shortcut can't be removed from used apps (without adding it to favs anyway), only destroyed entirely

What I would like? Treat shortcuts just like apps.

title: Speech recognition?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: Is it possible?

title: Keyboard-typed characters arrive out of order
body:
When I type "terminal" on bluetooth keyboard slowly, it gets right: "terminal".
But when I type fast, it becomes "mrnial" or something like that.

When I quickly type "te" I get "et" and vice versa.

I think that:

* Typed text should get typed correctly regardless of slowness of searching of displaying tings
* Searches may be delayed by about 100 ms, not be done on each typed character.
* Newly arrived data should cancel and abort previous search, not queue up.

title: [Feature request] Favourite's ordering and grouping/Tags
body:
My suggestions would be:

1. The option of changing the favorites's order
2. Being able to group the favorites (messenger, SMS and whatsapp, for example)
3. The tags could be a lot more explored too (recent tags, for example).

Nice work, and thanks!!

title: Was "usage access" ever considered?
body:
Since SDK21, needs an extra permission, could be used as a new HistoryMode type: "App usage" and/or, as I would like it, as a way to influence the current "frecency" mode by weighting most used apps more (instead of just counting the number of starts).

Reference: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/usage/UsageStats.html

title: Idea for faster search
body: While the keyboard input is fine for entering words or sentences in the search bar, handwriting single letters directly on screen is faster when supported by an "intelligent" search engine that takes in account habits for THAT moment of day and day of week. It's what Z launcher implemented, and I think it would give its best in case of Kiss, being paired with its standard search mode.

title: Add a share intent for plain text queries
body:
Added an option to "Share" a plain search query:

Possible improvement: return the list of apps able to handle the intent directly in the menu instead of adding one more step.
Menu would then include "Add to Dropbox", "Translate", "Copy to clipboard", "Android Beam", etc.

![2017-02-15 22 28 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536844/22998330/18ea8cea-f38b-11e6-94c9-033c0409f896.png)
![2017-02-15 22 28 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536844/22998329/18e99dd0-f38b-11e6-9e6f-09479c22f245.png)

title: Not any substring finds a contact from address book.
body:
For example, supposing I have a contact named `s.FooTrollolo` it often fails to find it when I type `trol` (it shows empy search results). Only `s Fo` seems to be reliable way show a contact.

I want to find a contact by any substring, not only just by prefix, just like with apps.

title: Icon issues with changed dpi
body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536844/23003155/a12d2154-f3a3-11e6-96e5-d034c87c2d4d.png)


Using [Compacticons HD](https://www.xda-developers.com/top-five-icon-packs-you-cant-find-on-the-play-store/)
Having dpi lowered from default 480 to the real 424 (as per resolution and screen size)

Icons that exist appear ok, see TotalCommander, but icons that get only an overlay (there is no full icon available) see ForkHub there, don't show up properly (eg. overlay with normal icon inside)

Also tested with [Numix Circle](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.numix.icons_circle), icons with overlays show this too.

That being said, tested on another device with dpi changed from 320 to 294 but there they show up ok.

title: Folders
body:
Hi everybody, I hope this is not a duplicate. I couldn't find anything related in the issues, so I'm starting a new one.

I think it would be great if KISS had an option to add virtual folders. It would work like this:

1. Press-and-hold app
2. Click "Add to folder"
3. If there are already folders, present list, else let user add a new folder, e.g. "Games"
4. Start typing "Games": The folder comes up
5. Click on the folders and only see apps that were previously added to the folder. (Indicate that one is inside a folder by, for example, changing search bar colour, like with the "all apps" view vs "recent apps" view.)

I hope I explained myself well, if not, I'll try to answer your questions! :) 

What do you think?

title: [Feature Request] 100% transparent search bar on the dark transparent theme(or on all themes if people wanting it)
body:
I'm just gonna copy/paste what I sent in an email. 
But to all the people involved in this app one way or another, then you're awesome! I don't see another home launcher beating this one in terms of size(all around), and its easy and very, very, fast and smart. 

Anyways here's the email I sent to the address from the play store but it I was told that here would be better this way to get a feature request(hopefully it's a small one)seen. 

"Hi.Â 

I'm an avid fan of your launcher. I've added reviews to your launcher on the play store under the name Scott Deez.Â 


Anyways I thought emailing you might be a quicker way to get your attention. So I do have one feature request: Is it possible to get the bottom search bar totally transparent, with the green circle 'home' button still being visible?Â 


Because I do use the dark transparent theme with a plain black wallpaper. And there's another launcher like yours(kind of a rip off of yours) and that search bar is totally transparent. And my screen looks really sexy with the black wallpaper and the transparent bar...Â 


Well, I'm sure you're busy but wanted to drop a line anyways to ask if you could fit this request in at some point.Â 


Best launcher there is. So easy. Really appreciate what you've done/doing.Â 


Thanks,Â 
DeeZ"

I'm sure others would enjoy this feature as well. 

â˜º

title: `LauncherApps` API and foreign-profile application support
body:
Android 5 had introduced a new API for interacting with apps specifically for launchers. Usage of this API is not optional anymore however, as new system app management features (such as launching protected apps and apps from work-mode profiles) can only be correctly accessed using this API and because such features were actually (attempted to be) used by our users (#597, #542).

Issue #542 also has most of the development history of this change recorded.

title: Inconsistent search results
body:
Hey everybody,

When I type "A", Amaze comes up before Ampere. When I type "Am" Ampere is first. Is that intended? It annoys me a lot because I have launched Ampere often when I actually wanted to launch Amaze (and press the wrong list entry because it changed order).

Screenshots: 
![screenshot_2017-01-16-21-51-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8948865/21998754/0523626a-dc37-11e6-85c3-3c55b21579fb.png)
![screenshot_2017-01-16-21-51-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8948865/21998854/64d9f1d8-dc37-11e6-8b21-0c85ddb77573.png)



I'm on KISS 2.25.0. My phone is a Fairphone 1 running Android KitKat 4.4.2.

title: [Feature Request] Add option to choose what goes into history
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
For example, could we have an option to disable contacts, setting toggles, etc. from populating the history.  Like if you only wanted apps to populate history could be another example.

Thanks!

title: [Feature Request] Maximum history limit
body:
Any way we can limit the number of history items to a number that the user chooses? 
 
This can help prevent the history from receiving too many items/clutter.

Thanks!

title: Adding scrolling favorites
body:
Something I personally really wanted.
Currently has a max of 15 items, arbitrary I know.

title: [Feature Request] Chose Browser for websearch
body:
Would it be possible to chose the browser in which to open web searches? On my phone they open in the Cyanogenmod Gello browser, but it would be useful to chose firefox or alike.
Loving the Launcher so far, thanks for the great work!

title: Faster contact reading.
body:
Cache column indices for cursor reading. This increases reading speed by about 10%.

For my contact list with 336 entries the measured timings are:

| | "old" loading | with changes |
|--|---|---|
| 1 | 249ms | 229ms |
| 2 | 265ms | 224ms |
| 3 | 282ms | 225ms |
| 4 | 281ms | 218ms |
| 5 | 256ms | 223ms |
| 6 | 272ms | 229ms |
| avg | 267.5ms | 224.6ms |

The changes are quite minor, so including this should not have negative side effect.

title: [Feature Request] Option to disable animation
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body: Any chance we can get an option to disable the animation when opening/closing the application bar?

title: Combination of some setting does not make sense
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi
I have set the option to show favourites bar above search field.
When selecting the minimalistist UI mode the option to hide favourites bar enables and selecting it causes a blank space to appear the text field.
Also since I had already specified the favourites, tapping on the blank space opens the favourites' app.
![screenshot_20170107-195124](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17181586/21742523/cb7ae50a-d516-11e6-9ac1-66e1b7945091.png)
![screenshot_20170107-195132](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17181586/21742522/cae31c34-d516-11e6-9299-dd45b0647b58.png)

title: Allow user to tune number_of_history_items and number_of_search_results
body:
As discussed here: #595 
Tested on 4.4 

You can edit the number of search results and history items on Settings > History Settings > Max Values

Not sure about the strings

title: Text not visible on search bar.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hello
When the kiss launcher is in full mode the green background color hides the search text. I can see the search results but cant see whts being typed in the search box. 
Device: Motorola moto e ( rooted)
Custom rom ( Android Marshmallow)
Thanks

title: crash on opening protected apps (cyanogenmod/lineageos)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
With CM/Lineage you can protect apps with a secure pattern in Settings -> privacy (Cyanogenmod Settings) -> protected apps.

KISS (2.29.0) always crashes upon attempting to open any of the protected apps.

title: removing mobile data toggle on lollipop
body: fixing #594

title: Limit on tag search results
body: I have a tag applied to 16 apps but only 15 are displayed when I search for the tag

title: Network data toggle does not work - Show on rooted devices
body: Device: LG D331 non rooted with stock LG rom based on Android 5.0.2  with KISS launcher version 2.29.0

title: Remove phone number normalization (for now?!)
body:
Remove phone number normalization due to multiple subtle issues.
Also commented two lines in LoadContactsPojos.java, which still seem to contain hardcoded country prefixes.

title: Roadmap of new features
body:
How about discussing which new features we should / could add on KISS? (It's not exactly a roadmap) 
I could start the list with these:
- widgets 
- plugins support  maybe? 
- color support for KISS circle 
- place search bar on top? 
- performance: reindexing takes long and happens often on some devices 
- notification bar color / transparency

title: Improved selectable item background
body:
KISS was using function `applyDesignTweaks()` to apply the borderless background that is only available on Android SDK > 21.

This was also the only reason we had two different layouts for contacts, which doesn't make a lot of sense too!

This PR cleans up everything using a custom `?attr`, whose value will depend on the current SDK version.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Added option to change Default Launcher
body:
We've added an option, located under 'Advanced Settings', for the user to be able to change his default launcher.

It was fairly easy to locate the parts in the source code that needed to be modified. Since the feature we wanted to implement consisted of adding an option to the settings screen, we knew from the start that most of our changes would be focused around the file *preferences.xml*.

Adding the extra option to the settings screen was the easy part. We just had to add an extra entry to *preferences.xml* and create a new *Preference* class.

*preferences.xml*
```java
<PreferenceScreen android:title="@string/title_advanced">
    <fr.neamar.kiss.preference.DefaultLauncherPreference
        android:dialogMessage="@string/default_launcher_warn"
        android:key="default-launcher"
        android:title="@string/default_launcher_title"/>
```

*DefaultLauncherPreference.java*

```java
public class DefaultLauncherPreference extends DialogPreference {

}
```

The difficult part came afterwards. We had to find a way to change the Default Launcher.

Well, turns out this is simply impossible to do programmatically. As you can imagine, allowing an application to set the default behavior of the phone would be a major security problem.

As such, the only solution was to ask the user to change the Default Launcher himself. But how could this be accomplished?

We could create an [App Chooser](https://developer.android.com/training/basics/intents/sending.html#AppChooser), but that raised a problem. It didn't allow the user to set an app as default. It only allowed to select the app for that *specific* action, at that *specific* moment. So this wouldn't be any good.

After struggling for a while to find an answer, we came across [this](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13167583/clearing-and-setting-the-default-home-application/13239706#13239706) post, on Stack Overflow.

And so, we decided to follow this approach.

We simply had to *trick* the phone, in order for it to think that there was a new app installed, so that it would show the App Chooser (notice that this chooser now has the option to set default apps, since it was launched by the System itself, and not programmatically).

In order to do this, we created a dummy (or fake - however you want to call it) Activity. As the name suggest, this is just a *completely* empty Activity. But this alone isn't enough. We need to tell the System that there is, in fact, a new app capable of receiving *Home* intents (the *Intent* launched when the *Home Button* is pressed). This was done in the *AndroidManifest.xml*, by declaring an *intent-filter*.

*DummyActivity.java*
```java
public class DummyActivity extends Activity {

}
```

*AndroidManifest.xml*
```java
<activity android:name=".DummyActivity">
    <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />
        <category android:name="android.intent.category.HOME" />
        <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT" />
    </intent-filter>
    </activity>
```

Now, all that was left was to fill the *DefaultLauncherPreference* and trick the phone into launching an App Chooser through the System.

This was done by creating a new *ACTION_MAIN Intent*, with a *HOME* category associated to it, and then launching it.


*DefaultLauncherPreference.java*
```java
// create a new (implicit) intent with MAIN action
Intent intent = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_MAIN);
// add HOME category to it
intent.addCategory(Intent.CATEGORY_HOME);
// launch intent
context.startActivity(intent);
```

However, after the first time this was used, it would stop working, because the phone would no longer assume the DummyActivity was a new app. The phone already knew it, so the App Chooser wouldn't launch, since the user had already selected what default app he wanted.

In order to avoid this, DummyActivity needs to start off disabled, in order to *hide* it from the system. It then gets enabled when it's time to launch the intent that will trick the phone. After that, it is disabled once again, in order for it to be reusable the next time we need to trick the phone.

*AndroidManifest.xml*
```java
<activity android:name=".DummyActivity"
      android:enabled="false">
      <intent-filter>
          <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />
          <category android:name="android.intent.category.HOME" />
          <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT" />
      </intent-filter>
  </activity>
```

*DefaultLauncherPreference.java*
```java
// get dummyActivity
ComponentName componentName = new ComponentName(context, DummyActivity.class);

// enable dummyActivity (it starts disabled in the manifest.xml)
packageManager.setComponentEnabledSetting(componentName, PackageManager.COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_ENABLED, PackageManager.DONT_KILL_APP);

// create a new (implicit) intent with MAIN action
Intent intent = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_MAIN);
// add HOME category to it
intent.addCategory(Intent.CATEGORY_HOME);
// launch intent
context.startActivity(intent);

// disable dummyActivity once again
packageManager.setComponentEnabledSetting(componentName, PackageManager.COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DISABLED, PackageManager.DONT_KILL_APP);
```

And it is complete. Now, everytime the user selects the option to change the Default Launcher, an App Chooser will appear.


Note: This suffers from the same issue we've stated [here](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/issues/575).

title: Performance improvement suggestion
body:
Dear developers,
I found a bitmap displaying issues in Kiss. These issues could affect performance. 
In the position of Kiss:
fr.neamar.kiss.IconsHandler.java     cacheGetDrawable()
the bitmap object is created with the invocation of decodeStream(). 

I found cacheGetDrawable() is invoked indirectly by:
fr.neamar.kiss.adapter.RecordAdapter.java    getView()
getView() callbacks are frequently invoked in the UI thread and this means that there will be many bitmap objects being created.

Maybe we can define memory cache to store the bitmap objects. Then app can reuse them instead of creating new bitmap objects continuously. Also, we can use the Option.inbitmap to reuse the memory space of existing bitmap objects, which will greatly reduce the memory consumption and improves app's performance.

By the way, for bitmap displaying, I was also wondering why you do not use third-party libraries such as picasso, glide? Would you mind sharing some thoughts?

Looking forward to your response and hope I can help improve Kiss.
Thanks.

References: 
https://developer.android.com/training/displaying-bitmaps/cache-bitmap.html
the use of inbitmap: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ioFW3cyRV0&list=PLWz5rJ2EKKc9CBxr3BVjPTPoDPLdPIFCE&index=54
https://developer.android.com/training/displaying-bitmaps/manage-memory.html

title: Issue #550
body:
This should fix issue #550.

Matching the international prefix was not working properly. Numbers starting with the international prefix were therefor handled as if they were starting with the national prefix.

The sample input number in the ticket was something like "00431234123412". The international prefix for austria is "00". The old implementation was trying to match this with "00431234123412".matches("00"). However this would return true if the whole string was matching (which is not the case). I changed this to using a [matcher](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/regex/Matcher.html) and its [lookingAt](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/regex/Matcher.html#lookingAt()) method, which returns true if the pattern matches parts of the input string.

title: Improve ci build
body:
This PR implements some suggestions from the [Circle CI docs](https://circleci.com/docs/android/) (some of which I added there in the first place). This _should_ make the ci builds more stable, though it will probably still be flaky. The main changes are:

- Gradle daemon is used in the ci build to speed it up slightly
- Gradle is given a larger max heap size to work with
- Gradle output should look better due to the command-line flag `--console=plain`
- Emulator is woken up and unlocked in a much better way than what was being used before (`adb shell input keyevent 82`)

title: Drop support for Android 2.3.3, 2.3.7, 3.0 and 3.1
body:
Android 2.3.3 is now only 2.1% of the existing KISS user codebase.

It's less than 1.5% worldwide according to https://developer.android.com/about/dashboards/index.html

We've been blocked for a long time by the huge gap between API-10 and API-11 (and even 14 for this matter).

This PR makes us move forward, and should ease development of new features and hopefully clean the codebase.

Opinions welcome from all contributors!

title: Making the release .apk smaller
body:
ProGuard  | ProGuard with -optimize | Proguard + ReDex | ProGuard optimize + ReDex
----|------|----|-----
487 KB | 349 KB | 455 KB  | 329 KB

If you are wondering why the starting size is so large, it's because I did the tests with my url-search-direct branch (Neamar:master w/ ProGuard only is 344 KB)

Currently the gradle build has _minifyEnabled_ and _shrinkResources_ set to true.
The optimized ProGuard only requires to change [this line](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/master/app/build.gradle#L15) from _proguard-android.txt_ to _proguard-android-optimize.txt_

ReDex claims to make the apk smaller and faster, and apparently it does. Here's the repo https://github.com/facebook/redex
The results are quite nice and the process is instant. The apk needs to be resigned after the reduction though.

title: Enable live wallpaper scroll based on listview position
body:
I believe a video is worth a thousand words:
[![screenshot from 2016-11-17 05-19-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1615426/20385423/6180d68c-ac85-11e6-9d82-5b9d61574782.png)](https://my.mixtape.moe/rdulyb.mp4)

* This changes notifies the live wallpaper of the position of the listview (in percentage) and allows the wallpaper to react accordingly.
* This translates the `y` change in `x` because most live wallpapers do not implement vertical movements. (the zero parameter sent is actually the `y` value).
* There is an inversion because it felt more accurate with my current live wallpaper (the one in the video). If someone has one and can test it, that would be great :)

title: Tagging applications
body:
This is a beta version for tagging of applications (fixes #394)
A new table is created in the db that contains one record id and a string (tag) per row
Long press on an app to show the menu with the option to edit/add a tag

When searching, if the app name doesn't match, an additional search is done inside the tag string.
If the query is contained (not regex search) the tag is highlighted

Known issues:
- When you update the tag on an app, the old tag is still visible until the screen is refreshed (e.g. scrolling)
- It doesn't work well with aliases. Results can appear duplicate if tag=alias. We should maybe disable aliases and use tags if this is merged

Any comment is welcome.

title: Contact renaming not reflected in search
body:
Hi,

I found an issue I am struggling with. I use owncloud to import my contacts. When I had to rename a contact in owncloud and synced it back to the phone, the new name is not reflected in the search results, but only in the contact itself when opened in the contact app.

How-to:
1. Sync contacts from owncloud to phone.
2. Search contact in KISS with the current name (a) -> success.
3. Rename contact in owncloud.
4. Sync contacts from owncloud to phone. 
5. Search contact in KISS with the changed current name (b) -> no success
6. Search contact in KISS with the previous name (a) -> success.
7. Open contact via KISS -> preview shows the previous name (a).
8. Edit contact in contact app -> changed name (b) is displayed.

---
- At this point I am not quite sure if this is an issue with KISS or with the underlying android, since the contact preview also does not reflect the change.
- After changing the phonetic name within the contact app, also the contact preview got updated and KISS shows the correct name. This is also available in the KISS search then.
- Other changes (like changing the contact picture) are immediatly available after the contact sync.

title: Feature Request: Ability to set custom scaling for more or less items in KISS
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Desired effect
The ability to see more smaller items in KISS , or
The ability to see less bigger items in KISS

Possible settings

```
Numbers -- high to low -- low to high -- follow dpi   -- Lots of options, technical -- recommend to follow dpi
small normal big                                      -- easy to understand , not a lot of options -- recommend other solution
Slider                                                -- A slider, less fine grain control but lots of options
```

[ A thread with some images with different dpi.](http://forum.xda-developers.com/z5-compact/general/change-dpi-root-t3335048) Notice how the dialer has more options in a smaller space "and looks better"

I Already do this to a limited extent by setting the dpi in android. I have my s5 running an asop rom at 400 dpi. The normal dpi is 480 I think. Makes it look more professional more professional and useful. I can see more status bar icons, more options in kiss, contacts, settings...

I would like to have it even smaller, and the ability to not have to set this globally to change one applications scaling ,ex kiss. As well as being more accessible to other people

title: Looking for maintainer
body:
Hey guys,

I guess this has been pretty obvious in the past months (#519 ><), but the amount of time I'm able / willing to spend on the project has steadily decreased to something like one weekend a month.

However, following the impulse of some very dynamic contributors (thanks!) the source code is moving at a much faster rate. At this point I guess it just doesn't make sense to be the sole BDFL when some people seems way more qualified than me in terms of Java development and performance.

So, is anyone willing to dedicate some time to help on this project? Details would need to be discussed (I guess we could have a Hangouts / discord / Skype / ... call to align our goals on the project), but the main idea would be to be the bad guy that say no to 50% of the feature and give constructive feedback on the other 50% :)

Of course, my favorite hypothetical co-admin would be someone who already contribute to the project and comment on issues -- I'm not going to list names because that wouldn't make a lot of sense, but I have a few people in mind that could be interesting, and would hopefully be interested too!

Looking forward to iron out the details with you guys :)

Addendum: hell, fuck this -- It actually makes sense to list some names, at least so people know what's going on! Apologies to those I forgot: @alexander255  @AltNico @ilmich @licaon-kter  @nmitsou @Pluggi

title: Customizable keyboard
body:
KISS uses a customized keyboard where
1. numbers are always shown in the keyboard widget, and
2. gesture typing is disabled.

I fully understand why this is a reasonable setting. However,
1. I never enter numbers in KISS. The extra row however takes away precious space that would otherwise reveal another history item (6 instead of 5 items, a 20% increase in history shown!), and
2. as I use gesture typing anywhere else, the KISS keyboard gets me stuck, which is frustrating and slows down significantly. It gets most painful when I want to use it for internet search, where you enter several words.

Therefore I would very much appreciate if both of these decisions could be made by the user through settings.

title: fixing KISS listed as app
body:
I am fixing a bug in my commit [here](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/492/files#diff-6b03b81542bb53162d59723d31286d9cR360), 

As mentioned in #501 , Kiss could be visible in the application list but under the following assumptions:
- Your excluded list app is not set (new KISS installation)
- You have uninstalled an app (any app)

Edit:
Let me explain one more time how this bug works.
If a user has never excluded any app through KISS and used the 2.24.1 version, then the moment that he uninstalls an app (any app) then KISS will be visible in the application list.
To fix that he would have to manually exclude KISS from the application list. 
That would insert KISS package back in the excluded app list setting

title: Use preference screen to group settings in subscreens
body:
The Android guideline says that "if you have more than 14 settings items, move them to subscreens".
https://material.google.com/patterns/settings.html#grouping-settings

We have 31 settings right now, and the settings screen is starting to be really hard to understand.

I've replaced PreferenceCategory with PreferenceScreen to use subscreens instead, making for a cleaner settings UI.

I've also move around some settings that should have been in another category in the first place.

Known issues:
- when toggling a setting that require an app restart, the user is brought back to the main settings screen :\
- the lack of an actionbar can really be felt in subscreens, where you want to press the "up" button but can't see it

What do you think?

title: Support for SDK v10
body:
As mentioned in #479 we currently have some issues with SDK v10,

The last working version is 2.23.0, the first broken version is 2.24.0. (thanks @alexander255)

(note that 2.23.0 is not in prod right now, the play store version is still on 2.22.1, I don't remember exactly why but there were some issues with 23)
The question is now: what do we want to do?

Two options: drop support for older SDK (up to which one?) or restore a working build.

According to the Playstore, here are the versions currently in use:
![versions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536844/16836360/174f5fda-49b5-11e6-8cf6-ac9e4b64fdb0.png)

SDK 10 is Android 2.3.3, that's 5% of our users (it used to be much more one year ago :))

What do we gain by dropping support for 10?
How hard is it to restore a working build for v10?

I'm not sure we get much by upgrading the minSdk, but I may be wrong.

Opinions welcome!

title: Dinamically reload contacts
body:
Hi,

this is my attempt to fix annoying bug that prevent ContactProvider to refresh itself when user add/delete/update a phone contact.
I've used a custom ContentObserver that is activated when something is changed on the internal database of contacts.

Unfortunately this mean that also when someone call (android refresh contact with timestamp of the last call) all contacts are reloaded.
For me this is more reasonable than restart kiss or deactivate/reactivate contact provider when I add someone to my phone book :)

Cheers.

title: Home number detection hardcoded (not working in DE, for example)
body:
In LoadContactsPojos.java the field "homeNumber" is set true, if the contacts phone number starts with "+33\s?[1-5]" (which is specific for france, I guess). Depending on the value of "homeNumber" the send message button in the contacts view is hidden or shown.

A solution usable in other countries would be nice here.

[TelephonyManager](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/telephony/TelephonyManager.html) provides some info on the surrounding of the phone. But no drop-in solution.

Maybe we have to manually collect regexes for home number detection per country?

Please let me know if you have any questions.
Ayman Abdelghany.

title: use Java collection interfaces rather than specific implementation

This pull request is focused on resolving occurrences of Sonar rule squid:S1319 - â€œDeclarations should use Java collection interfaces such as "List" rather than specific implementation classes such as "LinkedList" â€. You can find more information about the issue here: 
https://dev.eclipse.org/sonar/rules/show/squid:S1319
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Ayman Abdelghany.

title: Smart history2
body:
#419

Ordering of apps based on `frecency = frequency * recency`
`Frequency = number_of_launches_for_app / total_number_of_launches`
`Recency = 1 / position in normal history = 1/ (max(id) in history - max(app_id))`

The ordering is computed inside the sql query. Group by is needed. To avoid group by on all hisotry results i first limit to the 750 latest history entries. My initial tests indicate that smart history is ~2x slower than the normal history (which I think is still fine).
- Could someone test? First enable smart history on settings > advanced > history mode
- Any ideas about the titles in the settings?

title: bug setting image as wallpaper
body:
Instead of selecting the centre of the picture, KISS sets the left side. 

I.e.  
Imagine a desktop wallpaper. Now we divide it in 3 parts: [1|2|3](left, middle and right) and we want part 2 as the central part of our phone wallpaper. Well, what KISS does is dividing it in 2 bigger parts [1|2](left and right) and picking 1 (left) as the wallpaper.

title: [FEATURE] seperate Home and Lockscreen wallpapers
body:
By default, AOSP uses the same wallpaper for both the lock screen and the home screen: /data/system/users/0/wallpaper . KISS follows this convention and uses the same wallpaper.

The problem is that there's no way for people running stock, AOSP based ROMs, to define one wallpaper for the home screen, and a separate one for the lock screen.*

So, what I came up with, is to add a checkbox for non-default wallpaper that will add a "Set as KISS Wallpaper" option in the gallery. Maybe under Share... This way, the default wallpaper that's defined with "Set as Wallpaper" would continue working for the lockscreen and the default launcher, while KISS could have it's own wallpaper.

*CM uses a second file for the lock screen called /data/system/users/0/keyguard_wallpaper . But for people running stock AOSP ROMs there's only /data/system/users/0/wallpaper for both .

title: Thoughts about favourite apps/pinning
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body: After using the favourite apps pinned in the bar for a while I realized that pinning is absolutely not useful (imho). The number of pinned application is limited to only four items and we have to think that if a user pins an application it means that that app is one of his favourites so there is a high probability to find it already in history... Personally I always find my apps searching with text or looking at the history without using the bar. I think that the best approach (imho again) is giving the user the ability to choose a list of favourite apps to show in the main screen instead of the history (from the setting the user should be allowed to choose history/favourite). @nmitsou has already implemented this feature (see #346), the overhead of code introduced in KISS is quite small and KISS won't be much more complex with that great addition.

1. Find application from KISS somehow, for example, using green ring or entering uncomfortable application name (i.e. in non-default langauge)
2. Long-press to open KISS's menu for the app
3. "Tags"
4. Type space- or comma-separated tags in text box. For example, "game".
5. "OK"

Now typing "ga" should also bring apps tagged "game".

For example, when a system app is disabled but it remains in the launcher or someone activate the terminal in the Developer Options but it doesn't show up. Restarting the launcher solves these problems.

title: Better fuzzy search
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="waiting-for-review")]
body:
So I was motivated to solve #282 in a better way than #361 (not a Levenshtein distance, but the real thing like in sublime-text, as requested in the issue).

Sorry @nmitsou ^_^'

It looks like this for now:
![screenshot from 2016-02-01 23-15-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1615426/12733282/395a5b62-c93a-11e5-9005-4ff84f6b7ed5.png)

Comparaison with #361:
- Highlighting of the matched text
- Maybe faster
- Cannot auto-correct typos (`clogk -> clock`)

This PR also adds support for multi-part highlighting.

Here is how the score is calculated:
- A positive match is given the base score of 20
- 30 points are given gradually with the percentage of characters matched
- 50 points are given gradually with the percentage of word starting characters matched (uppercase, or preceded by a whitespace). This allows queries that contain the beginning of a word to have a much better ranking.
- => This totals to a score going from 20 to 100
- The more fragmented the matches are, the less the result is significant (see [this line for the actual formula](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/compare/fuzzysearch?expand=1#diff-e39439cc0b190cd66e530d81fd898679R80)).

Can someone test it and provide some feedback, especially on the ranking of the apps?

/cc @Neamar @nmitsou @emersion

title: [IDEA] Publish the search functionality as a standalone app in the Play Store
body:
The whole app's idea is great.
But some of us looking for a tiny bit more function here and there.
Again, that is not everyone - maybe not even the majority.
And having more functions go against the KISS principle.

**The idea**:  
- Have the search (when the keyboard pops up) bundled in a separate, tiny app. 
- This new app should contain the same functionality, without being a launcher.
- This new app should allow to be opened with the long-press of Home.
  - Like Google Now. KISS Launcher already allows this. 
  - The app should still have an icon, so Home Launcher or other shortcut callers could launch it as well. Such as gesture calls in other Launchers.

**Why not just open the launcher?**
Reason is simple: While the launcher is tiny, Android can still slow down to load it.
Then, since it's a launcher, it stays in memory.
While the app itself is tiny, the Developer and Application Manager tools show a ~100MB of RAM usage.
This ram usage can be shared I realize, but on my Exynos 5433 the search window still takes quite a few seconds to pop up from a different launcher, which means the phone does have to work extensively to load it up.

  **I do realize that this requires additional work.** But it should be a fast process. Literally drag and dropping almost all the files, removing the launcher part, call it a day.

title: Settings that require restart are not changed when Home is pressed
label: [Label(name="require-more-information")]
body:
This is easiest tested by changing the KISS theme, if you set a new theme and then press Home the MainActivity will still have the old theme or seems to stick to the theme that was set when KISS launched.

This will also affect the spellcheck and force portrait settings. You probably need KISS to be set as the default Launcher to see this effect too and it may only affect Android 5+.

It seems that Android is unwilling to fully unload the Launcher activity and if you force it to then you get to stare at your app drawer for a few seconds while it restarts.

I believe that the spellcheck setting can be removed from the list that requires restart though if you implement it in the onResume with another int like

```
private final int spellcheckDisabledType = InputType.TYPE_CLASS_TEXT | 
            InputType.TYPE_TEXT_VARIATION_VISIBLE_PASSWORD |
            InputType.TYPE_TEXT_FLAG_NO_SUGGESTIONS;
```

to restore the EditText to its default InputType value when spellcheck is disabled. It might be a good idea to look into ways to remove the forced restarts for other options too.

title: Fuzzy search
body:
As described in #282, I use the Levenshtein distance from here: http://rosettacode.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance
to recover mainly from typos while writing (I think the license is fine, code can be reused freely)
"The Levenshtein distance between two strings is defined as the minimum number of edits needed
to transform one string into the other, with the allowable edit operations being
insertion, deletion, or substitution of a single character."
It does NOT use phonetics (like soundex) or other NLP ideas

Performance-wise, I didn't notice any difference (tested on Samsung Note II and HTC Chacha).
It works only on AppProvider for now, i can add it on other providers if you agree.
I could also add an option in settings to enable / disable this if you think it is needed.

a few examples: _user query_ --> _matched app_

skyep or skipe or scipe (but also smzpe)--> skype
cuculato --> calculator
clog --> clock

title: How to fix Robolectric tests
body:
@Neamar
This is my reply to the comments on #335.

@alexander255 's [comment](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/335#issuecomment-164754840) was very imformative, and ties in with [this issue](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/834) I found, which suggests 2 ways of resolving the failing tests. So, to summarise, here are the options I think we could take:
1. Inject mocks into the `onServiceConnected` method that is causing the issues. See [this comment](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/834#issuecomment-28605830) for more info on this idea.
2. Follow [this comment](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/834#issuecomment-60786401), which is basically what @alexander255 was suggesting, I think, when he was talking about registering the services with Robolectric. Note I haven't tried this.
3. Don't test `MainActivity` with Robolectric as it uses services and Robolectric focusses on testing an individual activity on its own (again, see [this issue](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/issues/834)). It may make sense to test `SettingsActivity` with it though.
4. Get rid of robolectric and just use Espresso.

My preference is to go with the 3rd option, as it is quick and easy and Espresso tests can cover testing `MainActivity`.

title: Migrate project to marshmallow sdk
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Marshmallow has been out for a few months now...

But KISS is still compiling for Lollipop.

The biggest problem here is runtime permissions.

User is asked to give some specific permission at runtime, and not at install time.

As usual, the Android team messed up pretty hard and made everything way more complex than it could have been... adding more callbacks everywhere, and requiring an activity for pretty much any action.

Anyway. The problematic permission are the following ones:
- `READ_CONTACTS`
- `CALL_PHONE`
- `CAMERA`
- `READ_PHONE_STATE`
- `RECEIVE_SMS`

The first one, `READ_CONTACTS` is a core KISS feature, asking for it on the first run seems a good idea.

The second one, `CALL_PHONE` is required to call someone. We can probably ensure that we only ask for this permission when the user clicks on the phone button on a contact (although we'd have to handle the fact that this does not occur within the activity, and the callback is therefore called without any context, making our code much harder to understand)

Moving on. `CAMERA` is only required for the torch toggle. Same thing, asking for this at the latest moment seems the most sane option, and will also require some fiddling around with the activity ><

`READ_PHONE_STATE` and `RECEIVE_SMS` are actually easier. Since #325 they're disabled by default, which means we can ask for permission when the user checks them in the Settings screen. And the good news is that this time, we do have an activity to handle the callback!

From what I gather, all other permissions currently used by KISS are deemed safe and can be used without asking explicitly for user permission.

On a sidenote: migrating to marshmallow does not bring much to KISS in itself, but it's an investment for the future. And who knows, there may be some performance improvements!

title: KISS crashes after installation if shortcut provider is disabled (or not yet available)
body:
# Steps to reproduce
1. Disable the _Shortcuts_ _Data Provider_ in the KISS settings
2. Reinstall KISS (from `.apk`/`gradle`)
# Additional information

I originally thought that this was something introduced by me while working on #269. It turns out however that making provider initialization asynchronous, just makes the problem always show up, instead of only when the _Shortcuts_ _Data Provider_ is disabled.
The problem probably happens because (1) KISS always expects the _Shortcuts_ _Data Provider_ to be present and (2) KISS' own installation triggers a "package installed" broadcast.

title: Some apps create "empty" shortcuts on install
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
(cc @ilmich and #293)

After some investigation, it looks like the app which exhibits this behavior (Bankin', Dropbox) also come with a "custom widget" (in Google Now launcher, for instance, you can create a shortcut to open a folder directly).

Those applications have the intent-filter `<action android:name="android.intent.action.CREATE_SHORTCUT"/>` in their manifest for one of their activity (see for instance https://github.com/Neamar/CineTime/blob/master/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml#L89)

It looks like this triggers a "global" install shortcut upon installation, which leads to the shortcut appearing on KISS.

Two questions:
- if this is indeed why we get a shortcut, it should at least be for this customactivity handling the shortcut creation, not for the main activity
- how can we filter this and remove this? Or even more important, can we open this activity to let the user create a shortcut to display on KISS?

title: Supporting icons packs
body:
Hi,

unlike CyanogenMod and derivates, AOSP roms don't have theme support.
I think that it's nice to have icon theming on KISS Launcher.

I've take a look on ADW.Launcher source code to see how icon theming works and seems not difficult.
First problem is to detect installed icon sets, there are two ways

1) define a KISS intent that every icon pack developer must include into AndroidManifest.xml in order to launch a intent query that scan packagename for available icon sets (in order to get resource icons from external apk)
2) use, for intent query, another most supporter launcher (for example ADW)

Cheers.
Michele

title: Trim the string before normalization
body:
When using some keyboard+spellchecker (e.g. swiftkey keyboard does this) the inserted word automatically has a trailing space. In some cases the query (for instance â€œstore â€) does not match the intended result (for instance â€œPlay storeâ€)

I think trimming the string in the string normalizer should fix this problem (and do no harm) however please note that _I did not test my code_.

WARNING: this is probably not ready to be merged yet, because of the issues below. It's good enough for daily use though, and is probably worth discussing.

Issues:
- Not all apps provide a search activity
  - The most notable missing apps are:
    - The Google app
    - The DuckDuckGo app
    - Browsers
    - Wikipedia
- Some apps provide a search activity, but it crashes
  - For example Google Newsstand
- Some apps provide a search activity, but it requires more than just a
  query
  - For example Gmail
- Some apps provide a search activity, but when you give it a query, it
  opens without preforming a search
  - For example Podcast Addict, Amazon Kindle, and Coursera
- Search results are not retained in the recent apps list
  - I don't care if the searches are stored, but it'd be nice if the

Michele

title: Make DataHandler an Android service
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently KISS will terminate when the system is somewhat low on memory. Since KISS is usually the system launcher it will generally be the last background activity killed. Once the KISS `.MainActivity` is killed it has to rescan all data sources on its next start-up.

While the current situation isn't too bad it would, I think, be better to migrate KISS' `DataHandler` to an Android service to reduce the risk of it being killed (services are killed last). Also killed services are automatically restarted once their required memory becomes available again (so even if the service is killed it might be ready again by the time the user returns to the launcher). 

I've looked into the Android documentation and it seems that moving `DataHandler` into its own Android service isn't all that hard (as long as you don't try to share that service with other processes). See [this example](http://developer.android.com/guide/components/bound-services.html#Binder) for details.
## Steps to reproduce (artificial but always works)
1. Open _Device Settings_ â†’ _Developer Options_
2. Change _Apps_ â†’ _Background process limit_ to _No background processes_ (Process means Activity in this case)
3. Install some random launcher (using any App Store)
4. Press the home button
   - It should ask you which launcher to open
5. Select some launcher **other than KISS** from the list
6. Start _KISS Launcher_ from the other launcher
7. Press the home button again
8. Select the other launcher again
9. Start _KISS Launcher_ from the other launcher again
## Step to reproduce (more realistic)
1. Open KISS Launcher (while its the home screen launcher)
2. Start some memory intensive application
3. Wait until KISS' activity is stopped in the background (using `logcat` for instance)
4. Press the home button
## What should happen?

_KISS Launcher_ should be closed when opening the other launcher/doing the memory intensive task and started again when returning to it. On the second invocation it SHOULD NOT have to rescan all its data sources again (being unusable while doing so).

On a Nexus 5, the "task bar" (where the clock, the battery, the network, etc. are displayed) background is transparent and thus unreadable.

![screenshot_2015-09-16-16-11-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6382548/9917793/93623cee-5c91-11e5-8e00-5fc4ade77ffb.png)

title: Add "About"
body:
Menu entry "About" with information: 
- current version of app
- donate 
- Wiki (or something)

title: Dark airplane icon on dark mode
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Other settings icons look Nice, but not this one.

![screenshot_2015-09-13-08-32-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/506932/9892330/084553c2-5c0e-11e5-9871-1d7c8e8ee198.png)

title: Pixelated contact pictures border
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: ![screenshot_2015-09-07-23-16-10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/506932/9892315/e0136a1a-5c0d-11e5-92d7-6a578b3812f9.png)

title: Explanatory text for settings are unreadable with light themes
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Hello,

When using a theme other than the Dark Theme, explanatory text in settings are unreadable, because they do not change their colours, they are still displayed in light colour.

title: Sluggish performance after many History entries
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hello,

I am using a Moto G 2013. Currently when the history is populated, scrolling performance becomes laggy, and unresponsive. It would be nice to see this fixed.

Please indicate if any further info is needed about the issue.

Thanks in advance.

title: Improve search within device settings
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello,

It would be nice to be able to search all entries within device settings, AFAIS, it is limited to certain toggles like Airplane mode etc.

Thanks in advance.

title: Toggle for synchronisation
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello,

It would be useful to have a toggle for switching on/off synchronisation, since it is not included in the stock Android notification drawer.

Thanks in advance.

title: Theme for Eink devices?
body:
Hi

I am trying to use this app on my Eink Android device. Everything is generally fine except that I can't see what I am typing. I am wondering if there could be a theme for eink devices which has better contrast, no animation and better text visibility (like bigger text etc)

thanks

title: Toggle active without me
body: I'm seeing the toggles for Silent and Bluetooth seemingly acting by themselves. I haven't found a pattern for this but it's been going on for the month or so I've used kiss. I'd this a known bug on some configurations?

title: List of application suggestion
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Hi,

In my opinion it would be useful if people could choose what apps to include in the main page of the launcher withouth depending on the history. This approach can lead to some benefits, the history in fact, doesn't need to be calculated and the icons appear always in the same position.
Everybody could select a list of apps and keep them under their fingers in the fastest way!

What do you think about?

title: Feature Request: Hide History
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: The default mode of having the history list is rather large and takes up the whole screen. An option to 'hide history' could hide the menu which would free up the screen to the the wallpaper, leaving just the search bar at the bottom. Selecting the Kiss logo to bring up the app drawer would stay as is.

title: The option 'unistall ' appears in preinstalled apps
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When I press and hold any app I can remove them from the history, view the app info or uninstall, the third option appears in preinstall apps like phone, camera, calculator, settings, etc. If I click the option the app begins the uninstallation and after some seconds the system crash or the system becomes lag for a while. I suggest that for this kind of apps the option 'uninstall' shouldn't appear, so we can avoid future problems or the auto destruction of our phone (just kidding :) ).

title: "Not to show history " option
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body: I'd like to have the option to hide the history of the apps that I opened. Something like never save the app history. I know that we have the option to reset the history, but it is so annoying to reset it every moment.

title: Change the search bar position
body: It will be fine to have an option for change the search bar to the top or to the bottom

title: Properly set torch state on releaseCamera() method
body:
This fix a bug that not properly set torch state to false when releasing camera.
To reproduce issue, light on torch and launch something. KISS release camera (and light off torch), but toggle state remains wrong.

title: Changelog
body: Please provide a changelog with each release. Preferably add it in git source, otherwise atleast add it to F-Droid & Play Store app page.

title: Text on settings screen is hard to read with "light" theme
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
After installing 2.7.4, I noticed that the subtext on the settings screen and status bar icons are now very hard to read/see when the "light" theme is applied (see screenshot)
![screenshot_2015-09-10-12-23-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1474209/9798690/7adf2e04-57b7-11e5-89d0-6724c1c02a22.png)

title: Add support for USSD code
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Here is a simple fix for #219.

The regex was made from this wikipedia page : https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unstructured_Supplementary_Service_Data

> The USSD code format is (%)(%)%XYZ(*text)#, where () indicates an optionnal element, % is either # or *, X, Y and Z are digits and text is an alphanumeric text.

(This quote has been modified a bit because the first digit can be something else than a 1, contrary to what is said)

title: Fix issues with English strings
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
As mentioned by me in [#163](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/issues/163#issuecomment-132603751) there are some issues with the English source strings that need to be addressed.
A complete list of issues may be found in the _Source string comments_ of the [German translation](https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/kiss/strings/de/?type=comments).

This pull request addresses all issues except for number 11 (_Aliases for the Battery configuration screen would be useful._). The commits are grouped by what they change.

title: Hide keyboard when displaying KISS bar
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is useless to show the keyboard when the KISS bar is visible, so this pull requests hides it when the user clicks on the button.

This is an answer to @aeuii's comment in #199.

title: Copy phone number
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This pull request adds the ability to copy the phone number of a contact.

Side note: I also changed string/menu_app_remove to string/menu_remove as it is used across all menus.

title: Hide apps
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body: There are a lot of phones which come with preinstalled bloat apps that cannot be disabled. It would be nice to be able to hide specific apps in KISS so that these apps that you'd never use won't show up when searching or viewing the app list.

title: Old-looking contact pictures
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The default picture for contacts is a grey Android, and it doesn't look really nice in KISS. Would be great to have a better default picture! :-)

When the USSD code entered in the search bar, there is no Call option for that.
Clearly, the first asterisk or hash not recognized to bring up Call option.

body: In my phone the keyboard doesn't appear (I have to set it always visible by the settings) and I don't see what I'm typing since the key pressed are not shown in the keyboard bar. I use Google Keyboard

title: Shortcuts needed
label: [Label(name="help wanted")]
body: There are many applications, like Greenify, that give the users the opportunity to create useful shortcuts in order to perform various operations (like hibernating apps in the case of Greenify, or boost ram or add events to calendars etc). In my opinion it would be great if these shortcuts could be added in KISS launcher

Is it possible to add the description of a nuumber in the launcher?

When a contact have two number, it's convenient!

Removing the constant image load from the display function (called by

The same could be made for the others data types.

At the moment pressing the menu button (3 vertical dots) opens a dialog overlaying the whole app. I suggest that to be more consistant with other apps and Android UI, it should open an actual menu.
It is an opposite issue to #200 ğŸ˜‰

title: Second page for widget
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
New issue for my suggestion made in #145 :

> I thought about something about widget, why not offer a second page, at left or right, for add some widget. KISS is very efficient to access app but sometime there is some widget that is really more fast. I think to an agenda widget for displaying all next events. It could be faster to swipe left or right to see it than open agenda app.

title: Allow dashes in queries
body: Will fix #203

title: Transparent theme
body: Will fix  #137 and #139.

title: 4 items on menu displayed error
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
4 items which displayed nearest items
 sometimes don't display. ex : contact item,   don't add new item

title: Direct dial USSD number fails
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: It dials the number without the trailing hash

title: 180Â° orientation
body:
KISS wont rotate 180 degrees (reverse portrait).

To solve this you need to change `android:screenOrientation` in the `AndroidManifest.xml` from `"portrait"` to `"userPortrait"` :)

reference: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/activity-element.html

title: App list sorting options
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I find the whole inversed alphabetical sorted pull down for A to Z system rather awkward.

Any chance to get a settings option to set scroll direction? Now it's A ( bottom ) to Z ( top ), I would like to be able to inverse that so I can scroll down to Z. 

Also some other sorting options besides alphabetical, something like **less used first** ( since the main list kinda covers the most used option ) would be nice.

title: Change app menu style
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi, currently holding a touch over an item in the list opens a menu, which is hooked to the item. The problem is that when the item is at the top of the screen, the menu show up below the item and when item is at the bottom, the menu appears above it. It is always a bit of a surprise for the user where to expect the menu. This part of the UI does not feel predictable.

I would prefer to have a static overlay menu/dialog that covers the whole app and is centered. I think it's called Dialog [1].

What do you think?

[1] https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/dialogs.html

title: Smart keyboard hiding
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi, I have the â€œDisplay keyboardâ€ active and the launcher starts with a visible keyboard.

I think it would be useful to hide the keyboard automatically as soon as I start scroll the list down. The scrolling usually indicates that I'm are not interested in typing any more and want to see the items at the top of the list. Hiding the keyboard would save a lot of space and show more items.

This is just a suggestion, so please consider, if auto-hiding the keyboard will not make the UX unexpected and â€œhectic.â€

Thank you for a great app!

title: Application list not updated on "Protected Apps" changes
body:
Using Cyanogenmod I can hide less used apps so that I don't have a cluttered app list.
KISS updates the app list on un/install only, afaiks, so even after a KISS crash the app list was not updated.

Any chance of either KISS reruning app detection on "Protected Apps" changes or maybe add a menu entry to "Update app list" ?

Thanks

title: support for different search Engines
body: I use Ixquick.com (I reject Google) but even startpage.com good

title: KISS always displays and searches English names
body:
Apps can have several names, depending on the language. For example, on an English device, Contacts is called "Contacts",  but if I set my language to Dutch it is called "Contacten". KISS, however, always displays and searches in the English names, even if the app has another name in the language in question.

Example on a Dutch phone, where "Contacts" is called "Contacten" in other launchers, KISS still uses the English name:
![screenshot_2015-08-21-00-44-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1885159/9397772/52a85a04-47a0-11e5-9aac-48e6cd618b5c.png)

title: String normalization only works for some languages
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is mostly copy-and-pasting from the string normalization related stuff posted at #140.

Mostly string normalization means de-accenting and lower-casing of letters.
Examples of this include:
- French/German/Swedish/Estonian/Hungarian/Finnish/Icelandic diaeresis: `Ã„` â†’ `a`, `Ã¤` â†’ `a`, `Ã«` â†’ `e`, `Ã–` â†’ `o`, `Ã¶` â†’ `o`, `Ãœ` â†’ `u`, `Ã¼` â†’ `u` 
- French/Italian/Spain/Polish/Czech/Slovak/Macedon acutes: `Ã€` â†’ `a`, `Ã¡` â†’ `a`, `Ãˆ` â†’ `e`, `Ã©` â†’ `e`, `ÃŒ` â†’ `i`, `Ã­` â†’ `i`, `Ã’` â†’ `o`, `Ã³` â†’ `o`, `Ã™` â†’ `u`, `Ãº` â†’ `u`, `Ã½` â†’ `y`
- Hungarian double acutes: `Å` â†’ `o`, `Å‘` â†’ `o`, `Å°` â†’ `u`, `Å±` â†’ `u`
- French/Italian/Catalan/Portuguese/Scottish Gaelic/Welsh graves: `Ã€` â†’ `a`, `Ã ` â†’ `a`, `Ãˆ` â†’ `e`, `Ã¨` â†’ `e`, `ÃŒ` â†’ `i`, `Ã¬` â†’ `i`, `Ã’` â†’ `o`, `Ã²` â†’ `o`, `Ã™` â†’ `u`, `Ã¹` â†’ `u`, `áº€` â†’ `áº`, `á»²` â†’ `á»³`
- And many moreâ€¦

The [current code](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/blob/master/app/src/main/java/fr/neamar/kiss/normalizer/StringNormalizer.java) only handles some of these cases (`Ã¨`, `Ã©`, `Ãª`, `Ã«`, `Ã»`, `Ã¹`, `Ã¯`, `Ã®`, `Ã `, `Ã¢` and `Ã´`). While the list could certainly be extended, [implementing all possible cases](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?oldid=674250888) would be a lot of work (279 standardized combinations!). Instead I'd suggest [using something like this code](https://gist.github.com/alexander255/d431ea365216d05ec32d), which handles all possible combinations that exist today as well as _all future combinations added Unicode_ (unless I messed up something). It also handles characters that have (effectively) the same meaning but different codepoints (such as `ã` â†’ `kg`, `â… ` â†’ `I` or `â…¡` â†’ `II`), while that may not be relevant for keyboard input it wouldn't be surprising to have apps use such characters in their names (and it actually requires just one extra _character_ of code to implement this, see the inline documentation.)

title: Desk clock app intents correction and Improvement
body:
In **_ASUS Tablets**_, searching for the clock app related strings didn't emerge any results:
On further code inspections finally the answer was in the palm of **LoadAliasPojos.java** class!!

As I edited the answer in the **SO** [provided link](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3590955/intent-to-launch-the-clock-application-on-android), the package names added according to the predefined form. and then in the last if condition, it seems not correct to be messagingApp string there, so replaced by clockApp string already defined in the previous line.

title: DeskClock intents correction and Improvement
body:
For **_ASUS Tablets**_, searching for clock app related strings didn't emerge any results:
On further code inspections finally the answer was in the palm of **LoadAliasPojos.java** class!!

As I edited the answer in the **SO** [provided link](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3590955/intent-to-launch-the-clock-application-on-android), the package names added according to the predefined form. and then in the last if condition, it seems not correct to be messagingApp string there, so replaced by clockApp string already defined in the previous line.

title: Detect search providers, enable all by default, allow disabling multiple in settings
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
When discussing [adding DDG search](https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/124), @saveman71 and @Neamar had a good idea: why not just detect "apps that can search", and allow you to open a search directly in those apps from KISS?

This is similar to how [DDG's `!bang`s](https://duckduckgo.com/bang) work, but a little different (you don't add anything to your query (e.g. `!g`), you just select the app to search in). Have a look at how Firefox for android does it:
![screenshot_2015-08-10-18-05-38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/666493/9186538/8cd092a4-3f8b-11e5-9dc1-feeccd9fac1c.png)

Some notes:
- I think we should enable all providers by default, and enable newly installed providers. It'll probably be easy to write bugs here
- I'm closing #124, because I like this idea better. However:
  - Some of that code may still be useful, feel free to grab it from [my ddg branch](https://github.com/losingkeys/KISS/tree/ddg)
  - I _think_ there was a _slight_ performance hit when [reading the default search provider value from `preferences.xml`](https://github.com/losingkeys/KISS/blob/b54328efbe432404e8ee1c8ca752b57d050034b4/app/src/main/java/fr/neamar/kiss/DataHandler.java#L49-L51), because it would lag enough to trigger [StrictMode](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/StrictMode.html)'s red border right after I hit the home button.
- It looks like [`MultiSelectListPreference`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/preference/MultiSelectListPreference.html) will do the trick for selecting search providers in the preferences, but we'll need to find another solution for older phones.
