title: GPU Rendering Profile: constantly updating lists?
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="invalid"), Label(name="question")]
body:
I decided to see if there was a way to see how fast this app was, just in case I could make it faster :). I came across a few things ([tracingview (code changes)](https://developer.android.com/tools/debugging/debugging-tracing.html), [leakcanary (code changes)](https://github.com/square/leakcanary)), but the easiest thing I found was a developer setting:

https://developer.android.com/tools/performance/profile-gpu-rendering/index.html

Here are some screenshots from a recent build of master:

![screenshot_2015-07-08-19-56-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/666493/8585783/84d772d2-25ac-11e5-8ebe-a01272a42233.png)

This is what it looks like when you scroll around a lot. Nothing to worry about here, it's under the green (16ms) line, so it should be @ 60fps (like [the docs](https://developer.android.com/tools/performance/profile-gpu-rendering/index.html) say).

![screenshot_2015-07-08-19-54-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/666493/8585784/86c6fa04-25ac-11e5-8af4-270d6fdc98dc.png)

The graph looks like the above image if I leave it for awhile. This is strange because, if I leave it in (for example) the device settings, the graph doesn't progress until I start scrolling. This makes me think that something is happening each second. Reading  [the docs](https://developer.android.com/tools/performance/profile-gpu-rendering/index.html) again, it says that the red space is "time spent by Android's 2D renderer issuing commands to OpenGL to draw and redraw display lists". Does this mean the list is being updated/messed with each second? 

This could all be wrong; I'm fairly new to android. Anyway let me know what you think!

title: Append incoming SMS senders to history
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
With popular demand (@amoki, @rdarricau, @sandoche)!

When the device receives an SMS, add the sender to the history list.

This will require a new permission, but will probably be very useful so you stop forgetting to reply.

title: Choppyness when returning to this launcher when the keyboard was previously visible
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Maybe we can trigger a render (in the background?) if and only if the "show keyboard on load" option is unchecked? Unfortunately this could slow things down.

See the comments on #107 for more info (specifically starting with this one: https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/issues/107#issuecomment-118570435).

title: Should search items stay in the history?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
I say yes, though maybe non-apps should have a checkbox under their section to disable this?

See https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/124 for the original suggestion.

title: Added alias for Clock application
body: Will fix #115.

title: Initial support for DuckDuckGo search
body:
Warning: this breaks (at least) Serbian (I think?) translations, as I
don't know Serbian and it wasn't as easy as copying around the proper
nouns (like it was with French).

Also: fixed the Google Web Search URL. `http://www.google.com/#q=` wasn't working for me. Replaced with the one DuckDuckGo sends you to when you use `!g` (e.g. https://duckduckgo.com/?q=!g%20test).

Also: updated English translations to indicate we were doing a search,
not necessarily from the web (uses the Google Search app if possible,
and I intend to add support for the DDG app in the future).

Still todo (mostly copied from app/src/main/java/fr/neamar/kiss/result/DuckduckgoSearchResult.java):
- Use DDG app if available
- Programatically grab !bang commands and parse them for names (maybe
  just on startup or manually? Hardcode?
- Add option (in the settings underneath the option that enables DDG)
  that uses apps for some bangs if installed

title: Apk built in Eclipse crashes
body:
Here it is: http://pastebin.com/6PV9uDCe

Build procedure: Import project, compile. I couldn't compile with project build target set to 4.4.2, Eclipse reported following errors:

Console:

```
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] /home/mladen/KISS/app/src/main/res/values-v21/themes.xml:4: error: Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name '@android:style/Theme.Material.Light.NoActionBar'.
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] 
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] /home/mladen/KISS/app/src/main/res/values-v21/themes.xml:7: error: Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'android:colorAccent'.
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] 
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] /home/mladen/KISS/app/src/main/res/values-v21/themes.xml:5: error: Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'android:colorPrimary'.
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] 
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] /home/mladen/KISS/app/src/main/res/values-v21/themes.xml:6: error: Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'android:colorPrimaryDark'.
[2015-06-25 14:04:09 - MainActivity] 
```

Problems:

```
error: Error retrieving parent for item: No resource found that matches the given name '@android:style/Theme.Material.Light.NoActionBar'.   themes.xml  /MainActivity/res/values-v21    line 4  Android AAPT Problem
```

So I had to set build target to 5.0.1 and compilation went without error. _However, compiled apk installs normally and then crashes upon running the app._

Apk that was built: http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=16810351527158045937
sha256sum: 7c786d8dc05165250ebd8e0341041a560c8abcf7646ca379a620a69de9ab9b3e

title: Missing some toggles?
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I'm not sure if all of these are possible for this app, but here's the list of things I can toggle from my notification area:
- Brightness (auto/manual)
- Flashlight
- ~~WiFi~~ (already working in app)
- ~~Bluetooth~~ (already working in app)
- Sound Profile (vibrate/loud)
- Interruptions
- NFC
- Screen Rotation (auto/fixed)
- Location
- Airplane mode (linked in this app, not yet a toggle; I opened #109 to see if it can be made a toggle)
- SmartShare Beam (not sure what this is, might be an LG thing)
- Battery Saver (I think this just toggles whether or not the battery save mode turns on @ 15%. Not sure if I can just toggle it on when I want to save battery. Might be an LG thing)
- ~~QuickMemo+~~ (this is an LG app, so it's already linked in this app)
- ~~QuickRemote~~ (another LG app, already linked because it's an app)
- LED
- Accounts & sync
- QSlide (LG thing?)
- Voice Mate (LG thing?)
- Screen timeout (could be handy for debugging w/o setting that adb setting)
- Cell Data
- Miracast (LG thing? Though this might just be in Android)
- Screen Color Inversion

So it's probably not worth implementing all of the LG things, and I'm not honestly sure how many of these you have access to, but imo it'd be useful to have toggles to these. :beers:

title: Airplaine mode isn't a toggle
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The airplane mode takes you to its settings page on my phone (LG G4). Threre's a toggle button on that page, but it'd be slightly more convenient if I could toggle airplane mode in the same way I can toggle bluetooth.

title: Toggle items don't stay in the history
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Shouldn't items that toggle settings (e.g. "Bluetooth") stay in the recent history list after using them? I noticed after searching for, and using the bluetooth toggle it didn't stay in the list.

If this was implemented, it'd probably be a good idea to either watch when they changed (so you could update the on/off value accordingly), because I have toggles in my notifications and settings areas too (so I could change the value outside of this list).

title: Keyboard is displayed sometimes when it shouldn't be
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
With "Display Keyboard" unchecked, you can get the keyboard to display without tapping the search box. Steps to reproduce:
1. Open an app with a textbox (like firefox)
2. Focus that textbox (so a keyboard opens)
3. Press the home/circle button

The keyboard will be displayed, even though the settings say it shouldn't be.

title: [UI] Add more padding to results and separators
body: If we search something results are too close to the separators. This is not so good by design. I suggest to allow changing the padding or hardcode value (bigger than current default).

title: Register history when clicking on favorites
AndroidProviders
body:
Search through the phone providers, depending on installed apps.

For instance, search through IMDB, Gmail, Calendar, etc.

I believe this can grow fairly complex, even using the architecture Android provides us (public providers).

Maybe it could be better to improve our current search providers, and add some actions (buttons on the right) :
- Search on the web, default action (using browser intent)
- Search on maps (using geo: intent)
- Search on phone (using default google search, already using this providers)

That way, we can keep our results fast (not guaranteed if we use other app providers, often using slooow data connection).

Merges #55 and #28, as i believe they will be solved together.
